Today, although some aspects of his rule remain controversial, Pilsudski's memory is held in high esteem in Poland. Together with his opponent Roman Dmowski he is regarded as a father of the modern Polish nation.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]Get�lio Dornelles Vargas[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Brazil[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1882 - 1954 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Get�lio Dornelles Vargas was President of Brazil, first as dictator, from 1930 to 1945, and in a democratically elected term from 1951 until his suicide in 1954. Vargas led Brazil for 18 years, the longest of any President, and second in Brazilian history only to Emperor Pedro II among heads of state. He favored nationalism, industrialization, centralization, social welfare and populism - for the latter, Vargas won the nickname "The Father of the Poor". He was a proponent of workers' rights as well as a staunch anti-communist.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vargas was brought to power by political outsiders and the rank and file of the Armed Forces in the Revolution of 1930, a reaction to his loss in elections earlier that year. His ascent marked the end of the Brazilian oligarchic Old Republic and states-dominated coffee with milk politics. He successfully influenced the outcome of the Brazilian presidential election of 1934, and instituted an authoritarian corporatist regime in 1937 known as the New State, prolonging his hold on power. Vargas went on to appease and eventually dominate his supporters, and pushed his political agenda as he built a propaganda machine around his figure.[PARAGRAPH:2]Vargas sought to transform Brazil from a plantation-based economy into an industrialized powerhouse under the guidance of the government intervention. His embrace of developmentalism was expressed not only in strong rhetoric, but also by lending protection to domestic industries and in a heavy investment budget aimed at kick-starting "strategic" sectors and setting up the necessary infrastructure. Vargas created state monopolies for oil (Petrobras), mining (Vale), steelmaking (National Siderurgy Company), alkalis (National Alkalis Company) and automobiles (National Motors Factory). His policies shaped the Brazilian economic debate for decades, from the governments of Juscelino Kubitschek and leftist Jo�o Goulart to the right-wing military dictatorship of 1964 to 1985. The protectionist trend was reversed by the 1990s with the liberal reforms of Fernando Collor de Mello and Fernando Henrique Cardoso.[PARAGRAPH:2]With the global rise of democracy in the aftermath of World War II, Vargas agreed to cede power in free elections, thus ending the Vargas Era. His popularity earned him a late presidential term, but mounting pressure and political strife over his methods led him to suicide. He was the first president in the country to draw widespread support from the masses and is regarded as the most influential Brazilian politician of the twentieth century. He had also been a lawyer and landowner who occupied the 37th chair of the Brazilian Academy of Letters from 1943 until his death in 1954.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]Lech Walesa[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Poland[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Born:[\BOLD] 1943 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Lech Walesa is a retired Polish politician and labor activist. A charismatic leader, he co-founded and headed Solidarity (Solidarnosc), the Soviet bloc's first independent trade union, won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1983, and served as President of Poland from 1990 to 1995.[PARAGRAPH:2]Walesa was an electrician by trade. Soon after beginning work at Lenin Shipyard (now Gdansk Shipyard), he became a trade union activist, for which he was persecuted by the Communist authorities, placed under surveillance, fired in 1976, and arrested several times. In August 1980 he was instrumental in political negotiations that led to the ground-breaking Gdansk Agreement between striking workers and the government. He became a co-founder of the Solidarity trade union movement. After martial law was imposed in Poland and Solidarity was outlawed, Walesa was arrested again. Upon his release from custody he continued his activism and was prominent in the establishment of the 1989 Round Table Agreement that led to semi-free parliamentary elections in June 1989, and to a Solidarity-led government.[PARAGRAPH:2]In the Polish general election of 1990, Walesa successfully ran for the newly re-established office of President of Poland. He presided over Poland's transition from communism to a post-communist state, but his popularity waned and his role in Polish politics diminished after he narrowly lost the 1995 presidential election. As of 2016, Walesa continues to speak and lecture on history and politics in Poland and abroad.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]Ramón Castilla y Marquesado[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]President of Peru[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1797 - 1867 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ramón Castilla y Marquesado was a Peruvian caudillo and President of Peru four times. His earliest prominent appearance in Peruvian history began with his participation in a commanding role of the army of the Libertadores that helped Peru become an independent nation. Later, he led the country when the economy boomed due to the exploitation of guano deposits. Castilla's governments are remembered for having abolished slavery and modernized the state.[PARAGRAPH:2]He assumed the presidency for the first time after general Domingo Nieto's death for a short period in 1844, then in 1845 until 1851, again from 1855 to 1862 and, finally, during a brief period in 1863.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]William III[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Prince of Orange, Stadtholder of Holland, Zeeland, Utrecht, Gelderland and Overijssel, King of England, Ireland, and Scotland[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1650 - 1702 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]William III was sovereign Prince of Orange from birth, Stadtholder of Holland, Zeeland, Utrecht, Gelderland, and Overijssel in the Dutch Republic from 1672, and King of England, Ireland, and Scotland from 1689 until his death. It is a coincidence that his regnal number (III) was the same for both Orange and England. As King of Scotland, he is known as William II. He is informally and affectionately known by sections of the population in Northern Ireland and Scotland as "King Billy".[PARAGRAPH:2]William inherited the principality of Orange from his father, William II, who died a week before William's birth. His mother Mary, Princess Royal, was the daughter of King Charles I of England. In 1677, he married his mother's fifteen year old niece and his first cousin, Mary, the daughter of his maternal uncle James, Duke of York.[PARAGRAPH:2]A Protestant, William participated in several wars against the powerful Catholic king of France, Louis XIV, in coalition with Protestant and Catholic powers in Europe. Many Protestants heralded him as a champion of their faith. In 1685, his Catholic father-in-law, James, became king of England, Ireland and Scotland. James's reign was unpopular with the Protestant majority in Britain. William, supported by a group of influential British political and religious leaders, invaded England in what became known as the "Glorious Revolution". On 5 November 1688, he landed at the southern English port of Brixham. James was deposed and William and Mary became joint sovereigns in his place. They reigned together until her death on 28 December 1694, after which William ruled as sole monarch.[PARAGRAPH:2]William's reputation as a strong Protestant enabled him to take the British crowns when many were fearful of a revival of Catholicism under James. William's final victory at the Battle of the Boyne in 1690 is still commemorated by the Orange Order. His reign in Britain marked the beginning of the transition from the personal rule of the Stuarts to the more Parliament-centred rule of the House of Hanover.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]George I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of the Hellenes[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1845 - 1913 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]George I was King of Greece from 1863 until his death in 1913.[PARAGRAPH:2]Originally a Danish prince, George was born in Copenhagen, and seemed destined for a career in the Royal Danish Navy. He was only 17 years old when he was elected king by the Greek National Assembly, which had deposed the unpopular former king Otto. His nomination was both suggested and supported by the Great Powers: the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, the Second French Empire and the Russian Empire. He married the Russian grand duchess Olga Constantinovna of Russia, and became the first monarch of a new Greek dynasty. Two of his sisters, Alexandra and Dagmar, married into the British and Russian royal families. King Edward VII and Tsar Alexander III were his brothers-in-law and King George V and Tsar Nicholas II were his nephews.[PARAGRAPH:2]George's reign of almost 50 years (the longest in modern Greek history) was characterized by territorial gains as Greece established its place in pre-World War I Europe. Britain ceded the Ionian Islands peacefully, while Thessaly was annexed from the Ottoman Empire after the Russo-Turkish War (1877�1878). Greece was not always successful in its expansionist ambitions; it was defeated in the Greco-Turkish War (1897). During the First Balkan War, after Greek troops had occupied much of Greek Macedonia, George was assassinated in Thessaloniki. Compared to his own long tenure, the reigns of his successors Constantine, Alexander, and George proved short and insecure.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]Khosrow I[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]King of Kings of Persia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 501 - 579 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Khosrow I, also known as Anushiruwan the Just, was the twenty-second Shahanshah (King of Kings) of the Sasanian Persian Empire. His reign, lasting from 531 to 579, was the peak of the Sasanian dynasty and one of the last golden ages of pre-Islamic Iran.[PARAGRAPH:2]A philosopher king, Khosrow introduced several reforms in the administration of the Sasanian Empire, allowing its economy to prosper. He undertook many building projects across the empire. As a patron of the arts and sciences, he greatly expanded the Academy of Gondeshapur, and welcomed the Greek philosophers who left Athens after Justinian closed the Neoplatonist Academy. It was under his reign that chess, an Indian game, was introduced to Persia, from where it eventually reached the Western world. Militaristically, Khosrow waged several wars, including two as part of the centuries-old conflict with the Roman-Byzantine Empire. His achievements had a lasting impact on the culture of the Islamic world following the Muslim conquest of Persia, less than a hundred years after his death.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [H1]Aleksandr II Nikolayevich[\H1][NEWLINE][BOLD]Emperor of Russia[\BOLD][NEWLINE][BOLD]Lived:[\BOLD] 1818 - 1881 AD[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Alexander II was the Emperor of Russia from 2 March 1855 until his assassination on 13 March 1881. He was also the King of Poland and the Grand Duke of Finland.[PARAGRAPH:2]Alexander's most significant reform as emperor was emancipation of Russia's serfs in 1861, for which he is known as Alexander the Liberator. The tsar was responsible for other reforms, including reorganizing the judicial system, setting up elected local judges, abolishing corporal punishment, promoting local self-government through the zemstvo system, imposing universal military service, ending some privileges of the nobility, and promoting university education.[PARAGRAPH:2]In foreign policy, Alexander sold Alaska to the United States in 1867, fearing the remote colony would fall into British hands if there were another war. He sought peace, moved away from bellicose France when Napoleon III fell in 1871, and in 1872 joined with Germany and Austria in the League of the Three Emperors that stabilized the European situation. Despite his otherwise pacifist foreign policy, he fought a brief war with the Ottoman Empire in 1877-78, pursued further expansion into Siberia and the Caucasus, and conquered Turkestan. Although disappointed by the results of the Congress of Berlin in 1878, Alexander abided by that agreement. Among his greatest domestic challenges was an uprising in Poland in 1863, to which he responded by stripping that land of its separate constitution and incorporating it directly into Russia. Alexander was proposing additional parliamentary reforms to counter the rise of nascent revolutionary and anarchistic movements when he was assassinated in 1881.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]An academy is a school for advanced learning. Though China, Egypt, and India had such institutes earlier, the term "academy" was first applied to the Athenian school of philosophy, founded by Plato in approximately 390 BC. The school was built near a sacred grove named "Hekademia."[PARAGRAPH:1]An academy was an important asset for a city. It attracted both brilliant scholars and the children of wealthy or noble parents, who might then decide to settle in the city permanently. The academy could provide a broad, general education to its students, or it might concentrate upon a specific subject such as philosophy, mathematics, art, natural philosophy (the world and everything in it), or the martial arts.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today there are many educational facilities which bear the name "academy." The term is used loosely now, and in addition to its original meaning, is often applied to schools for children and teenagers.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Une académie est une école d'enseignement supérieur. Si la Chine, l'Egypte et l'Inde connaissaient déjà ce type d'instituts, le terme "académie" est appliqué pour la première fois à l'école de philosophie d'Athènes, fondée par Platon vers 390 av. J.-C. Cette école était construite dans un jardin nommé "Académie".[PARAGRAPH:1]Une académie constitue un atout important pour une ville. Elle attire de brillants érudits et les enfants de nobles ou de riches familles qui peuvent ensuite décider de s'installer définitivement dans la ville. L'académie peut offrir un enseignement général très vaste à ses étudiants ou se concentrer sur une matière spécifique telle que la philosophie, les mathématiques, l'art, la philosophie naturelle (le monde et tout ce qu'il comporte) ou les arts martiaux.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aujourd'hui, de nombreuses structures d'enseignement portent le nom d'"académie". Le terme est désormais utilisé assez librement et son sens originel a été élargi, s'appliquant souvent aux écoles pour enfants et adolescents.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Eine Akademie ist eine Schule der höheren Wissenschaften. Obwohl es in China, Ägypten und Indien bereits früher vergleichbare Einrichtungen gab, stammt der Begriff "Akademie" von der 390 vor Christus von Platon gegründeten Philosophenschule in Athen. Diese befand sich in der Nähe eines heiligen Hains mit dem Namen "Hekademia".[PARAGRAPH:1] Eine Akademie war eine wichtige Errungenschaft für eine Stadt. Sie lockte brilliante Gelehrte und die Kinder der Reichen und Adligen an, die sich vielleicht dauerhaft in der Stadt niederließen. Die Akademie bot ihren Schülern eine breite Allgemeinbildung oder spezialisierte sich auf ein bestimmtes Fach, wie Philosophie, Mathematik, Kunst, Naturkunde (die Welt und was sich darin befindet) oder Kampfkunst.[PARAGRAPH:1]Heute tragen viele Lehranstalten den Namen "Akademie". Der Begriff wird weitläufig verwendet und bezeichnet oft Schulen für Kinder und Teenager.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un'accademia è una scuola per l'apprendimento avanzato. Malgrado Cina, Egitto e India avessero fondato questi istituti molto tempo prima, il termine "accademia" fu coniato per la prima volta nella scuola Ateniese di filosofia istituita da Platone verso il 390 a. C. La scuola venne costruita presso un luogo sacro di nome "Hekademia."[PARAGRAPH:1]L'accademia rappresentava un luogo importante per la città poiché attirava studiosi brillanti con le proprie famiglie benestanti e nobili, che potevano decidere di trasferirsi definitivamente. L'accademia forniva un'educazione generale ai propri studenti e si concentrava sull'approfondimento di materie come la filosofia, la matematica, l'arte, la percezione del mondo e della natura o le arti marziali.[PARAGRAPH:1]Al giorno d'oggi esistono molti edifici dedicati all'istruzione che si fregiano del nome "accademia": questo termine viene oramai utilizzato in modo inappropriato e viene spesso citato a proposito degli istituti di istruzione per bambini e ragazzi.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Una academia es una escuela en la que se imparten conocimientos avanzados. Aunque este tipo de institución apareció primero en China, Egipto y la India, el término "academia" se aplicó por primera vez a la escuela de filosofía de Atenas, fundada por Platón en el año 390 d. C. La escuela se levantaba cerca de una sagrada arboleda llamada "Hekademia."[PARAGRAPH:1]La academia era un importante activo en una ciudad. Atraía a brillantes eruditos y a los hijos de los ricos o los aristócratas, quienes podían tomar la decisión de instalarse en la ciudad de forma permanente. Podía proporcionar una educación amplia y general a sus estudiantes, o podía concentrarse en materias más específicas, como la filosofía, las matemáticas, el arte, la filosofía natural (el mundo y todo cuanto contiene) o las artes materiales.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hoy en día existen muchas instituciones educativas que llevan el nombre de "academia". El término se emplea con libertad en nuestros días, y además de su acepción original, suele aplicarse a las escuelas para niños y adolescentes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An administrative center is a seat of regional administration or local government, or a county town, or the place where the central administration of a commune is located. Local Government is a form of public administration which in a majority of contexts, exists as the lowest tier of administration within a given state. The term is used to contrast with offices at state level, which are referred to as the central government, national government, or (where appropriate) federal government and also to supranational government which deals with governing institutions between states. Local governments generally act within powers delegated to them by legislation or directives of the higher level of government. In federal states, local government generally comprises the third (or sometimes fourth) tier of government, whereas in unitary states, local government usually occupies the second or third tier of government, often with greater powers than higher-level administrative divisions.[PARAGRAPH:1]The question of municipal autonomy is a key question of public administration and governance. The institutions of local government vary greatly between countries, and even where similar arrangements exist, the terminology often varies. Common names for local government entities include state, province, region, department, county, prefecture, district, city, township, town, borough, parish, municipality, shire, village, and local service district.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]During the 20th Century, the advent of the automobile has created an urban and suburban landscape in which people live in one area but can shop, play and work elsewhere - often miles away from their homes. Nowhere is this more true than in the United States of America, whose citizens are noted for an almost fanatical devotion to their cars. This has had important social, environmental and economic affects upon life in America, leading to (among other things) the creation of that most American of institution - the shopping mall.[PARAGRAPH:1]American shopping malls are surrounded by acres and acres of parking lots, and they may contain dozens (if not hundreds) of stores selling everything from clothing to jewelry to electronics to books to computers to videos. In some ways American shopping malls are akin in spirit to the old Arabian markets (although Americans don't particularly enjoy haggling and prices are generally fixed).[PARAGRAPH:1]The earliest automobile-centered shopping center was the "Market Square," opened in Chicago, Illinois, in 1916. Constructed in Minnesota in 1992, the "Mall of America" is the largest mall in the world. It contains over 500 shops, 80 restaurants, a theme park, hotel, and movie theatres. It is housed in a building large enough to hold over 30 Boeing 747 airplanes.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le XXe siècle voit l'avènement de l'automobile et l'apparition d'un nouveau paysage urbain et rural. Les individus vivent à un endroit, mais font leurs courses, se divertissent et travaillent ailleurs, souvent à des kilomètres de chez eux. Il n'y a pas de meilleur exemple que les Etats-Unis d'Amérique quand on parle de dévouement fanatique pour sa voiture. Les répercussions sociales, environnementales et économiques sur la vie des Américains sont évidentes. En effet, on a pu assisté (parmi d'autres choses) à la création de la plus américaine des institutions : le centre commercial.[PARAGRAPH:1]Les centres commerciaux américains sont entourés de parkings s'étendant sur des kilomètres et se composent de dizaines (voire de centaines) de magasins vendant toutes sortes de choses : vêtements, bijoux, matériel électronique, livres, ordinateurs, télévisions... Par certains côtés, les centres commerciaux américains ressemblent aux anciens souks arabes (même si les Américains n'aiment pas particulièrement marchandés et que les prix sont généralement fixes).[PARAGRAPH:1]Le tout premier centre commercial dédié à l'automobile fut le "Market Square", ouvert à Chicago dans l'Illinois en 1916. Le "Mall of America", construit dans le Minnesota en 1992, est le plus grand centre commercial du monde. On y trouve plus de 500 magasins, 80 restaurants, un parc d'attraction, des hôtels et des cinémas. Ce bâtiment pourrait accueillir plus de 30 avions Boeing 747.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Im 20. Jahrhundert entwickelte sich durch die Verfügbarkeit von Automobilen eine in städtische und vorstädtische Regionen unterteilte urbane Landschaft, die es ermöglichte, dass die Menschen in einem Stadtteil wohnten und in einem anderen Stadtteil einkauften, Freizeitaktivitäten nachgingen und natürlich auch arbeiteten - oft mehrere Kilometer von ihrem Zuhause entfernt. Nirgendwo fand diese Struktur mehr Anwendung als in den Vereinigten Staaten von Amerika, deren Bevölkerung dafür bekannt ist, eine fast schon fanatische Vorliebe für ihre Autos zu haben. Eine solche städtische Ordnung hatte tief greifende soziale, umweltpolitische und wirtschaftliche Auswirkungen auf den amerikanischen Lebensstil, die unter anderem zur Entstehung einer typisch amerikanischen Erscheinung führte: dem Einkaufszentrum.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die amerikanischen Einkaufszentren bieten gigantische Parkplatzflächen und können Dutzende (wenn nicht gar Hunderte) von Einzelgeschäften umfassen, die von Kleidung und Schmuck über Elektrogeräte bis hin zu Büchern, Computern und Videos nahezu alles verkaufen. In gewisser Hinsicht ähneln sie den alten arabischen Basaren (wenngleich die Amerikaner nicht unbedingt gerne feilschen und die Preise daher in der Regel von vornherein festgelegt sind).[PARAGRAPH:1]Das erste mit dem Auto erreichbare Einkaufszentrum dieser Art war das "Market Square", welches 1916 in Chicago, Illinois, seine Pforten öffnete. 1992 wurde in Minnesota mit der "Mall of America" das größte Einkaufszentrum der Welt eröffnet. Es enthält mehr als 500 Ladenlokale, 80 Restaurants, einen Vergnügungspark, ein Hotel und mehrere Kinosäle. Die Gesamtfläche des Gebäudekomplexes würde genug Platz für die Unterbringung von mehr als 30 Flugzeugen des Typs Boeing 747 bieten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'avvento dell'automobile nel XX secolo ha determinato un paesaggio urbano e suburbano tali per cui le persone possono vivere in una zona e lavorare, divertirsi e fare affari altrove, spesso a diversi chilometri da casa. In nessun luogo ciò è maggiormente vero che negli Stati Uniti d'America, i cui cittadini sono noti per la loro devozione quasi fanatica alle auto, che non ha mancato di avere importanti ripercussioni sociali, ambientali ed economiche in America, portando peraltro alla nascita di quella istituzione tutta americana che è il centro commerciale.[PARAGRAPH:1]I centri commerciali americani sono circondati da ettari ed ettari di parcheggio e possono contenere decine (se non centinaia) di negozi, da quelli di abbigliamento ai gioiellieri, da quelli di elettronica alle librerie e così via. In un certo senso i centri commerciali americani sono molto vicini ai bazar arabi (anche se agli Americani non piace trattare e i prezzi sono di solito fissi).[PARAGRAPH:1]Il primo centro commerciale con ampio parcheggio fu il "Market Square", aperto a Chicago (Illinois) nel 1916. Costruito nel Minnesota nel 1992, il "Mall of America" è il più grande centro commerciale del mondo: contiene oltre 500 negozi, 80 ristoranti, un parco dei divertimenti, un hotel e persino dei cinema. L'edificio del centro commerciale è talmente vasto da poter ospitare oltre trenta Boeing 747.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En el s. XX, la aparición del automóvil creó un paisaje en la ciudad y la periferia en el que la gente vivía en una zona pero podía comprar, jugar y trabajar en otra, con frecuencia a kilómetros de distancia de su hogar. En ningún lugar es esto más cierto que en los Estados Unidos de América, cuyos ciudadanos son famosos por su fanática devoción por sus coches. Esto tuvo importantes efectos sociales y económicos en la vida estadounidense, pues llevó (entre otras cosas) a la aparición de lo que sería una de las instituciones del país: el centro comercial.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los centros comerciales estadounidenses están rodeados de hectáreas y hectáreas de aparcamientos y contienen decenas (cuando no centenares) de tiendas en las que se vende de todo, desde joyas a electrodomésticos, pasando por libros, ordenadores y vídeos. En cierto sentido, los centros comerciales estadounidenses recuerdan el espíritu de los antiguos bazares árabes (aunque a los norteamericanos no es que les guste especialmente regatear y los precios suelen ser fijos).[PARAGRAPH:1]El primer centro comercial pensado para coches fue el Market Square, que se abrió en Chicago, Illinois, en 1916. El centro comercial Mall of America, construido en Minnesota en 1992, es el más grande del mundo. Contiene 500 tiendas, 80 restaurantes, un parque temático, un hotel y salas de cine. Se encuentra en un edificio tan grande que cabrían dentro 30 aviones Boeing 747.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok also referred to as "Angkor Wat" is a temple in Angkor, Cambodia. Wat Preah Pisnulok was constructed in the 12th century by King Suryavaman II to serve as the royal palace and state temple, Hinduism being the state religion. Two or three centuries later Wat Preah Pisnulok was converted to Buddhist use. Wat Preah Pisnulok is a complex of buildings surrounded by a wall and then moat. The enclosed area measures 3000 feet by 2600 feet.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wat Preah Pisnulok is constructed primarily of sandstone blocks. The complex is laid out in a rectangular pattern somewhat resembling that of an ancient fortress; the inner buildings are separated from the outer walls by a courtyard similar to a bailey one might find in a castle.[PARAGRAPH:1]At one time the courtyard was filled with wooden buildings, but these have all since perished. The inner structure is split into three galleries built on raised platforms. The outer galleys once contained libraries, while the inner was a shrine to Vishnu (and has since been converted to a shrine to Buddha). The galleries are topped with towers that resemble stylized beehives, the tallest reaching about 140 feet in height. The buildings' walls are covered with ornate and beautiful bas relief sculptures depicting scenes from Hindu mythology.[PARAGRAPH:1]Though largely neglected in the latter half of the 20th century, serious efforts are now being made to preserve and restore this wonderful and unique place of worship, and pilgrims and tourists are visiting it in ever-greater numbers each year.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok aussi appelé "Angkor Vat" est un temple situé à Angkor, au Cambodge. Il a été construit au XIIe siècle par le roi Suryavarman II pour servir de palais royal et de temple d'Etat, l'hindouisme étant la religion d'Etat. Deux ou trois siècles plus tard, il est transformé en temple bouddhiste. Wat Preah Pisnulok est un complexe de bâtiments d'une surface totale de 1 500 m sur 1 300 m et entouré d'un mur et de douves.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wat Preah Pisnulok est construit essentiellement avec des blocs de grès, sur un modèle rectangulaire ressemblant à celui d'une ancienne forteresse. Les bâtiments intérieurs sont séparés des murs extérieurs par une cour, similaire à la cour intérieur que l'on pourrait trouver dans un château.[PARAGRAPH:1]A l'origine, la cour contenait des bâtiments en bois mais ils ont tous disparu. La structure intérieure est divisée en trois galeries construites sur des terrasses surélevées. Les galeries extérieures contenaient autrefois des bibliothèques tandis que celle du centre était un sanctuaire dédié à Vishnou (qui est désormais consacré à Bouddha). Les galeries sont surmontées de tours ressemblant à des ruches stylisées, les plus grandes pouvant mesurer près de 43 m de haut. Les murs des bâtiments sont recouverts de sculptures comportant de magnifiques bas-reliefs richement ornés représentant des scènes de la mythologie hindoue.[PARAGRAPH:1]Grandement négligé pendant la deuxième moitié du XXe siècle, de sérieux efforts sont désormais entrepris pour préserver et restaurer ce lieu de culte unique et magnifique. Chaque année, le nombre de visiteurs, qu'ils soient pèlerins ou touristes, ne cesse d'augmenter.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok als "Angkor Wat" bezeichnet auch ist ein Tempel im kambodschanischen Angkor. Er wurde im 12. Jahrhundert von König Suryavaman II. als Königspalast und Staatstempel errichtet. Wat Preah Pisnulok war zunächst ein hinduistischer, später ein buddhistischer Tempel. Die Anlage besteht aus mehreren von einer Mauer und einem Graben umgebenen Gebäuden. Die Gesamtfläche der Tempelanlage beträgt 900 mal 800 Meter.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wat Preah Pisnulok wurde primär aus Sandsteinquadern gebaut. Der rechtwinklige Gebäudekomplex erinnert an die Struktur alter Festungen, zumal die inneren Gebäude durch einen Hof von der Außenmauer getrennt sind.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die auf dem Hof errichteten Holzgebäude sind nicht erhalten. Wat Preah Pisnulok ist in drei Galerien auf erhöhten Plattformen unterteilt. Während in den äußeren Galerien Bibliotheken untergebracht waren, befand sich in der inneren Galerie zunächst ein Vishnu-, später ein Buddha-Schrein. Die Türme der Galerien erinnern an stilisierte Bienenstöcke. Der höchste Turm ist etwa 42 Meter hoch. Die Wände der Gebäude sind mit Flachreliefen verziert, die Szenen der Hindumythologie darstellen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nachdem Wat Preah Pisnulok in der zweiten Hälfte des 20. Jahrhunderts dem Verfall preisgegeben war, versucht man nun, diesen einzigartigen Ort, der Jahr für Jahr unzählige Pilger und Touristen anlockt, zu erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok anche denominato "Angkor Wat" è un tempio di Angkor in Cambogia, edificato nel XII secolo da re Suyavaman II: questa struttura era adibita a palazzo reale e tempio centrale, con l'Induismo come religione ufficiale. Due o tre secoli dopo, l'Wat Preah Pisnulok venne convertito al Buddismo. Questo complesso, delle dimensioni di un chilometro per ottocentometri, ospitava molti edifici circondati da una muraglia e un fossato.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wat Preah Pisnulok è costruito principalmente in pietra arenaria: il complesso è stato concepito a forma rettangolare e in qualche modo ricorda le antiche fortezze; gli edifici all'interno, sono separati dalle mura esterne da un cortile simile a quelli dei castelli.[PARAGRAPH:1]Un tempo, questo cortile ospitava degli edifici costruiti in legno che non hanno retto all'incedere della storia; la struttura interna è divisa in tre gallerie realizzate su piattaforme sopraelevate, mentre quelle esterne ospitavano biblioteche. La zona interna era un santuario dedicato a Vishnu (e successivamente riconvertito a Budda). In cima alle gallerie si trovano delle torri che ricordano la struttura degli alveari: la torre più alta raggiunge i 40 metri. Le mura dei palazzi sono ornate da meravigliosi bassorilievi che dipingono scene della mitologia Indù.[PARAGRAPH:1]Malgrado sia stato trascurato a metà del XX secolo, sono stati fatti molti sforzi per riportare questo tempio ai fasti di un tempo: ogni anno il luogo viene visitato da migliaia di pellegrini e turisti.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Wat Preah Pisnulok también se refiere como "Angkor Wat" es un templo en Angkor, Camboya. Fue construido en el s. XII por el rey Suryavaman II como palacio real y templo oficial, siendo el hinduismo la religión del estado. Dos o tres siglos más tarde se adaptó para ser utilizado por los budistas. Wat Preah Pisnulok es un complejo de edificios rodeados por una muralla precedida de un foso. El recinto mide 915 x 790 metros aproximadamente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Está construido principalmente con bloques de piedra arenisca. El trazado del complejo tiene una forma rectangular que recuerda vagamente a la de una fortaleza; los edificios del interior están separados de la muralla exterior por un patio, de manera parecida al patio de armas que puede encontrarse en un castillo.[PARAGRAPH:1]En el pasado, el patio estaba repleto de edificios de madera, pero todos han desaparecido. La estructura interior está dividida por tres galerías construida sobre plataformas elevadas. Las galerías exteriores antaño contuvieron bibliotecas, mientras que la interior era un altar a Visnu (y ha sido convertido en uno a Buda). Las galerías están coronadas por torres que parecen colmenas estilizadas, la más alta alcanza cuarenta y cinco metros de altura. Las paredes de los edificios están cubiertas con hermosos y recargados bajorrelieves que representan escenas de la mitología hindú.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque se ha descuidado muchísimo durante la segunda mitad del s. XX, en la actualidad se están haciendo grandes esfuerzos por conservar y restaurar esta maravilla y lugar único de veneración, y el número de turistas y peregrinos que lo visitan aumenta año tras año.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An installation intended for the cooling, freezing, and cold storage of perishable food products and other perishables. It operates as an independent enterprise, comprises a cold-storage warehouse with truck and railroad platforms, compressor and condenser rooms for a refrigerating system, a cooling tower, reservoirs and a pumping station for a circulating water supply, administration and residential buildings, and other buildings and installations.[PARAGRAPH:1]Port cold-storage facilities are used for the short-term storage of freight when freight is transferred from one type of transport to another, for example, from water to railroad transport, and are usually built in river ports or seaports. Central cold-storage facilities are intended for the long-term storage of products drawn from processing-and-procurement cold-storage facilities for the purpose of creating reserves. Commercial cold-storage facilities, such as refrigerated cabinets and sectional coolers, are used for the short-term storage of products at trading depots and in, for example, stores, dining rooms, and restaurants. In addition to general-purpose cold-storage facilities, which are intended for the storage of a wide variety of products, specialized cold-storage facilities are built for the storage of such products as fruits, vegetables, eggs, and salted fish.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Temple of Artemis was located in the city of Ephesus in modern Turkey, and it was considered to be one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. At its grandest the building contained more than 100 marble columns (each 50 feet or more in length) and covered an area larger than the Acropolis in Athens. The first temple built on the site was finished around 600 BC, but was burned down and destroyed some 50 years later. The temple was rebuilt starting circa 550 BC, and its new incarnation was even larger and more magnificent than before. Its construction was sponsored by the Lydian king Croesus and it was designed by the Greek architect Chersiphron. The temple was decorated with bronze sculptures made by the finest artists of the era, including Phidias, Polycleitus, Kresilas, and Phradmon. It served as both a marketplace and a religious institution, drawing tourists from far and wide across Greece and the Near East.[PARAGRAPH:1]Unfortunately, the Temple of Artemis was destroyed again in 356 BC by a man named Herostratus, who deliberately committed arson in an attempt to immortalize his name (in which he obviously succeeded). Legend has it that the temple burned to the ground on the same night as Alexander the Great was born, and that Artemis was too busy attending his birth to save her temple. After Alexander's death, the Temple of Artemis was rebuilt once more, achieving its largest and most impressive size yet. Aside from its roof, the new temple was made entirely out of marble, with steps leading up to a huge terrace that measured 260 by 430 feet in size. The temple was re-adorned with statues, paintings, and other fine artwork, and over time regained its position of glory.[PARAGRAPH:1]When St. Paul visited Ephesus in the first century AD, the Temple of Artemis was still standing and its priests had no intention of renouncing their goddess. Unfortunately, the building was burned down by the Goths during a raid in 262 AD. The Ephesians vowed to rebuild it, but interest in the Hellenic gods and goddesses was beginning to wane by that point. By 400 AD, most of the people of Ephesus had converted to Christianity, and the remnants of the temple were torn down by St. John Chrysostom. The marble from the temple was salvaged for use in other building projects, and almost nothing remains of the Temple of Artemis today.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le temple d'Artémis se trouvait dans la cité d'Ephèse, sur le territoire de l'actuelle Turquie, et constituait l'une des sept merveilles du monde antique. A son apogée, le bâtiment comportait plus de 100 colonnes de marbre, d'au moins 15 m de haut chacune, et couvrait une superficie supérieure à celle de l'Acropole, à Athènes. Le premier temple construit sur le site fut achevé vers 600 av. J.-C., mais fut brûlé et détruit environ 50 ans plus tard. La reconstruction d'un temple encore plus grand et plus beau débuta vers 550 av. J.-C. Elle fut financée par le roi lydien Crésus tandis que les plans étaient de l'architecte grec Ctésiphon. Le temple était décoré de sculptures de bronze réalisées par les meilleurs artistes de l'époque, dont Phidias, Polyclète, Crésilas et Phradmon. Il servait non seulement de place du marché et d'établissement religieux, mais attirait aussi les touristes de bien au-delà de la Grèce et du Proche-Orient.[PARAGRAPH:1]Malheureusement, le temple d'Artémis fut à nouveau détruit en 256 av. J.-C. par un homme appelé Herostratus, qui avait délibérément allumé un incendie pour immortaliser son nom, ce qu'il a visiblement réussi à faire. D'après la légende, le temple aurait entièrement brûlé la nuit où Alexandre le Grand serait né et Artémis, trop occupée à assister à la naissance, n'aurait pas pu sauver le temple. Après la mort d'Alexandre, le temple d'Artémis fut une nouvelle fois reconstruit, d'une taille plus grande et plus impressionnante encore. Excepté le toit, le nouveau temple était fait entièrement de marbre, avec des escaliers menant à une immense terrasse mesurant près de 80 m sur[NEWLINE]130 m. Le temple avait été une nouvelle fois orné de statues, de peintures et autres travaux artistiques minutieux, regagnant au fil du temps sa gloire ancienne.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lors de la visite de Saint-Paul à Ephèse au Ier siècle ap. J.-C., le temple d'Artémis existait toujours et ses prêtres n'avaient aucune intention de renoncer à leur déesse. Malheureusement, le bâtiment avait été une nouvelle fois détruit par les Goths lors d'un assaut en 262 ap. J.-C. Les Ephésiens avaient fait voeu de le reconstruire mais l'intérêt pour les dieux et déesses grecs avait commencé à décliner à cette époque. En 400 ap. J.-C., la majorité de la population d'Ephèse avait été convertie au christianisme et les vestiges du temple avaient été démolis par Saint Jean Chrysostome. Le marbre du temple fut récupéré pour la construction d'autres bâtiments et il ne reste aujourd'hui presque plus rien du temple d'Artémis.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Artemis-Tempel wurde in der Stadt Ephesos in der heutigen Türkei errichtet und gehörte zu den Sieben Weltwundern der Antike. Er enthielt mehr als 100 Marmorsäulen (von denen jede mindestens 18 Meter hoch war) und besaß eine größere Grundfläche als die Akropolis in Athen. Das ursprüngliche Tempelgebäude wurde etwa 600 vor Christus fertig gestellt, aber ca. 50 Jahre später durch einen Brand vollständig zerstört. Um 550 vor Christus beauftragte der lydische König Krösus den griechischen Architekten Cherisphon mit dem Wiederaufbau, der noch größer und prächtiger ausfallen sollte als das vorherige Gebäude. Der Tempel selbst war mit diversen Bronzeskulpturen geschmückt, die von den größten Bildhauern dieser Zeitepoche angefertigt worden waren, wie Pheidias, Polyklet, Kresilas und Phradmon. Neben seiner Funktion als Gotteshaus diente er auch als Handelsplatz und zog Reisende aus ganz Griechenland und dem Nahen Osten an.[PARAGRAPH:1]Unglücklicherweise wurde der Artemis-Tempel im Jahr 356 vor Christus abermals zerstört, dieses Mal durch den Brandstifter Herostratos, der auf diese Weise berühmt werden und seinen Namen für alle Zeit unvergessen machen wollte (was ihm offensichtlich auch gelungen ist). Der Sage nach soll sich der Brand in der Nacht der Geburt von Alexander dem Großen ereignet haben, weshalb die Göttin Artemis zu beschäftigt gewesen sei, als dass sie ihren brennenden Tempel hätte retten können. Nach Alexanders Tod wurde der Artemis-Tempel abermals wiederaufgebaut, und zwar noch größer und beeindruckender als zuvor. Mit Ausnahme des Dachs bestand das ganze Gebäude aus Marmor. Über eine Treppe gelangte man zu einer riesigen Terrasse, die etwa 79 mal 131 Meter groß war. Natürlich wurde auch dieses Gebäude mit wertvollen Statuen, Gemälden und anderen wertvollen Kunstwerken ausgestattet, so dass der Tempel mit der Zeit wieder in alter Pracht erstrahlte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Als der Apostel Paulus im 1. Jahrhundert nach Christus nach Ephesos kam, stand der Artemis-Tempel noch und die örtlichen Priester waren auch nicht im Mindesten geneigt, ihre Göttin zu verleugnen. Leider wurde das Gebäude jedoch während eines Überfalls der Goten im Jahr 262 nach Christus erneut zerstört. Obwohl die Bürger von Ephesos geschworen hatten, den Tempel auch diesmal wieder aufbauen zu wollen, ließ die Bedeutung der griechischen Götter und Göttinnen zu diesem Zeitpunkt bereits immer stärker nach. Bis 400 nach Christus waren die meisten Einwohner der Stadt zum Christentum konvertiert und die Überreste des Tempels wurden vom Heiligen Johannes Chrysostomos niedergerissen. Da der Marmor aus dem Gebäude später für andere Bauvorhaben weiterverwendet wurde, sind so gut wie keine Überreste des Artemis-Tempels mehr erhalten geblieben.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il tempio di Artemide si trovava a Efeso (odierna Turchia) ed era considerato una delle Sette Meraviglie del mondo antico. Nel momento di maggior splendore, il tempio era composto da oltre 100 colonne di marmo (alte ciascuna 15 metri o più) e copriva un'area più vasta dell'Acropoli di Atene. Il primo tempio venne terminato nel 600 a.C., ma 50 anni dopo fu bruciato e raso al suolo. Nel 550 a.C. circa venne ricostruito, ancora più grande e magnifico di prima. La sua edificazione venne sponsorizzata da re Creso di Lidia e curata dall'architetto greco Chersifrone. Il tempio fu decorato da sculture di bronzo scolpite dai più grandi artisti dell'epoca: Fidia, Policleto, Cresila e Fradmo. Il tempio era sia luogo di mercato sia istituzione religiosa e attirava visitatori da tutta la Grecia e dal Vicino Oriente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Purtroppo il tempio di Artemide fu distrutto una seconda volta nel 356 a.C. da un uomo di nome Erostrato, che volutamente appiccò un incendio per rendere il suo nome immortale (cosa nella quale riuscì). La leggenda vuole che il tempio collassò la stessa notte in cui nacque Alessandro il Grande, e che Artemide fosse troppo impegnata ad assistere a quel parto per salvare il proprio tempio. Dopo la morte di Alessandro, il tempio fu costruito ancora una volta, ancora più grande. Tetto a parte, era interamente di marmo; i gradini che portavano alla piattaforma centrale misuravano 80 metri per 130 ciascuno. Il tempio fu decorato ancora una volta con statue, dipinti e altre opere d'arte e col tempo riguadagnò la gloria.[PARAGRAPH:1]Quando, nel primo secolo d.C., san Paolo andò a Efeso, il tempio di Artemide era ancora in piedi e i suoi sacerdoti non avevano alcuna intenzione di rinnegare la loro divinità. Purtroppo il tempio fu arso di nuovo, dai Goti questa volta, in un'incursione del 262 d.C. Gli Efesini giurarono di riedificarlo, ma ormai la religione ellenica era sempre meno seguita. Nel 400 d.C. la maggior parte degli Efesini si era convertita al cristianesimo e ciò che rimaneva del tempio fu abbattuto da san Giovanni Crisostomo. Il marmo del tempio venne recuperato per essere usato nella costruzione di altri edifici e oggi del tempio non rimane quasi più nulla.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El templo de Artemisa se encontraba en la ciudad de Éfeso (situada en la Turquía moderna) y se consideraba una de las siete maravillas del Mundo Antiguo. En su momento de mayor esplendor, contenía más de cien columnas de mármol (cada una de ella de quince metros o más de altura y cubría un área superior a la de la Acrópolis de Atenas. El primer templo construido allí se terminó alrededor del 600 a. C., pero fue incendiado y destruido unos cincuenta años después. El templo se reconstruyó en torno al 550 a. C., en una nueva encarnación aún más grande y magnífica que la anterior. Su construcción fue costeada por Creso, rey de Lidia, y su diseño fue obra del arquitecto griego Kersifrón. El templo estaba decorado con estatuas de bronce realizadas por los mejores artistas de la época, como Fidias, Policleto, Cresilas y Fradmon. Servía como mercado y como institución religiosa y atraía a turistas de todos los rincones de Grecia y Oriente Próximo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Por desgracia, el templo fue destruido de nuevo en el año 356 a. C. por un hombre llamado Eróstrato, quien lo incendió deliberadamente para inmortalizar su propio nombre (cosa que evidentemente consiguió). La leyenda asegura que el templo ardió por los cuatro costados la misma noche que nació Alejandro Magno, y que Artemisa estaba demasiado ocupada con su nacimiento como para salvar el templo. Tras la muerte de Alejandro, el Templo de Artemisa se reconstruyó una vez más, aún más grande y más impresionante que las anteriores. Aparte de su tejado, el nuevo templo se fabricó enteramente de mármol, con escalones que ascendían hasta una enorme terraza de ochenta por ciento treinta pies. El edificio volvió a engalanarse con estatuas, pinturas y otras obras de arte, y con el tiempo recuperó su posición de gloria.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cuando san Pablo visitó Éfeso en el siglo I d. C., el Templo de Artemisa seguía en pie y sus sacerdotes no tenían la menor intención de renunciar a su diosa. Por desgracia, los godos lo incendiaron durante una incursión en el año 262 d. C. Los habitantes de Éfeso juraron que lo reconstruirían, pero por aquel entonces el interés por la cultura helenística estaba en decadencia. Hacia el año 400 de nuestra era, la mayoría de ellos se había convertido al cristianismo, y lo que quedaba del templo fue derribado por san Juan Crisóstomo. El mármol del templo, saqueado, se empleó en otras obras y hoy en día no queda casi nada del edificio.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In Aztec culture, religion was inextricably woven into the fabric of daily life. The king was the leader of the nation; he also held high office in the religion. Aztec religious policies had the full force of law behind them. When a condemned criminal was executed, he was killed on the same sacrificial altars that the Aztecs used to sacrifice captured prisoners (and others) during religious rituals.[PARAGRAPH:1]Despite their bloodthirsty - even savage - reputation, the Aztecs had quite a sophisticated judicial system to protect both person and property. Each major city or town had a supreme judge. Once appointed, the supreme judge was totally independent of the monarchy; he wielded ultimate judicial control over his jurisdiction. Beneath the supreme judge was a three-member court, and beneath them were a group of lesser magistrates who were elected to their office by the people of the city. There is little evidence of corruption in the Aztec courts: judicial misconduct was punishable by death.[PARAGRAPH:1]Though the Aztecs could be considered barbaric by most modern standards, their justice system was fairly effective at deterring crime and keeping the peace. For example, there could not have been much theft in the cities: the Aztec residences were not equipped with locks or even bolts.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Dans la culture aztèque, la religion faisait intimement partie de la vie quotidienne. Le roi était le chef de la nation mais il exerçait également de hautes fonctions religieuses. Les prescriptions de la religion aztèque avaient pleinement force de loi. Lorsqu'un criminel était condamné, il était exécuté sur les mêmes autels sacrificiels que ceux utilisés par les Aztèques lors des rites religieux pour le sacrifice, entre autres, des prisonniers.[PARAGRAPH:1]Malgré leur réputation sanguinaire, et même cruelle, les Aztèques disposaient d'un système judiciaire relativement sophistiqué pour protéger biens et personnes. Chaque ville ou bourg de taille relativement importante comptait un juge suprême. Une fois nommé, celui-ci était totalement indépendant de la monarchie et exerçait le contrôle judiciaire suprême sur sa juridiction. Sous son autorité, on trouvait une cour composée de trois personnes qui supervisaient un groupe de magistrats de rang moindre, élus par les habitants de la ville. Il existe peu de preuves de corruption dans les tribunaux aztèques, toute faute judiciaire étant passible de la peine de mort.[PARAGRAPH:1]Si, selon la plupart des critères modernes, les Aztèques peuvent être considérés comme des barbares, leur système judiciaire était relativement efficace pour prévenir la criminalité et maintenir la paix. Ainsi, il ne devait pas y avoir beaucoup de vols dans les villes car les résidences aztèques ne disposaient ni de serrures, ni de verrous.
TEXT.German: [TAB]In der aztekischen Kultur war die Religion untrennbar mit dem alltäglichen Leben verbunden. Der König war der Anführer der gesamten Nation und bekleidete zugleich auch das höchste Kirchenamt. Die Glaubenspolitik der Azteken wurde in vollem Umfang durch die Gesetzgebung gestützt. Wenn ein verurteilter Verbrecher hingerichtet wurde, geschah dies auf den gleichen heiligen Altären, die die Azteken auch für die Opferung Gefangener (oder auch anderer Personen) im Rahmen ihrer religiösen Rituale nutzten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl man ihnen Blutrünstigkeit und sogar Grausamkeit nachsagte, unterhielten die Azteken ein relativ ausgefeiltes Rechtssystem zum Schutz von Leib und Leben sowie des Eigentums. In jeder größeren Stadt gab es einen obersten Richter, der nach seiner Ernennung völlig unabhängig von der Monarchie agieren konnte und somit bei seiner Urteilsfindung die ultimative richterliche Gewalt innehatte. Dem obersten Richter unterstand zudem ein dreiköpfiges Gerichtsgremium, dem wiederum eine Gruppe niederer Magistrate unterstellt war, welche durch die jeweilige Stadtbevölkerung in ihr Amt gewählt wurden. Hinweise auf Korruption an den aztekischen Gerichtshöfen gibt es kaum: Auf Rechtsmissbrauch stand die Todesstrafe.[PARAGRAPH:1]Auch wenn man das aztekische Volk aus heutiger Sicht durchaus als barbarisch betrachten könnte, so war ihr Rechtssystem im Hinblick auf die Unterbindung krimineller Machenschaften und den Friedenserhalt doch recht effizient. Ein Beleg dafür ist, dass es aller Wahrscheinlichkeit nach kaum Diebstähle in den Städten gegeben hat, denn die aztekischen Häuser waren weder mit Schlössern noch mit sonst irgendwelchen Sperrvorrichtungen ausgestattet.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Nella cultura azteca la religione era inestricabilmente intrecciata con la vita quotidiana. Il re era il capo della nazione e anche gran sacerdote. Le politiche religiose azteche avevano la forza della legge dalla loro. I criminali venivano giustiziati sugli stessi altari sacrificali usati per i prigionieri e per altri tipi di vittime durante le cerimonie religiose.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nonostante la loro reputazione di barbari assetati di sangue, gli Aztechi vantavano un sistema giudiziario a protezione dell'individuo e della proprietà alquanto complesso. In ciascuna città o villaggio era insediato un giudice supremo. Una volta nominato, il giudice supremo era totalmente indipendente dal re e deteneva il pieno controllo giudiziario sulla sua giurisdizione. Sotto di lui operava una corte di tre membri e, sotto di questi, numerosi magistrati inferiori eletti dai cittadini. Non abbiamo molte testimonianze di corruzione nelle corti azteche: simili reati erano puniti con la morte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gli Aztechi potrebbero forse essere considerati dei barbari alla luce degli standard moderni, ma il loro sistema giudiziario era molto efficace nel prevenire i crimini e nel mantenere la pace sociale. Le case non venivano chiuse con lucchetti o spranghe, eppure il tasso di furti era molto basso.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]En la cultura azteca, la religión estaba indisolublemente unida al tejido de la vida cotidiana. El rey era el líder de la nación y también el magistrado religioso más importante. La policía religiosa azteca contaba con el respaldo de la ley. Cuando un reo era ejecutado, la ejecución se producía en el mismo altar que los aztecas utilizaban en los rituales religiosos para sacrificar a los prisioneros capturados.[PARAGRAPH:1]A pesar de su fama de sanguinarios e incluso salvajes, los aztecas tenían un sistema judicial bastante sofisticado para proteger tanto a la persona como la propiedad. Todas las ciudades importantes tenían un juez supremo. Una vez nombrado, el juez supremo era totalmente independiente de la monarquía y ejercía un control judicial total en su jurisdicción. Bajo el juez supremo había una corte de tres miembros y, bajo ella, un grupo de magistrados menores que eran elegidos por la población de la ciudad. No existen apenas evidencias de corrupción en las cortes aztecas. La prevaricación se castigaba con la muerte.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque, desde una perspectiva moderna, los aztecas podrían ser considerados bárbaros, su sistema judicial era bastante eficaz a la hora de combatir el crimen y mantener el orden. Por poner un ejemplo, no debía de haber muchos robos en las ciudades: las residencias de los aztecas no tenían cerraduras ni candados.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Warfare has been a recurring phenomenon throughout the history of mankind, and it continues to plague the world today. Although war is not a desirable situation, it is important that even the most peaceful of societies be prepared for the possibility of war. When warring nations are closely matched in technology and manpower, the army with the best training usually wins battles. Military schools and academies exist all over the world, established for the purpose of training military personnel in the latest methods, tactics, and technology. Men and women who graduate from such facilities possess higher than average command and military and technological skills, making them more effective in combat situations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La guerre est un phénomène récurrent dans l'histoire de l'humanité et elle continue à affecter le monde aujourd'hui encore. Si la guerre n'est pas souhaitable, il est important que même les sociétés les plus pacifistes soient préparées à son éventualité. Lorsque des nations en guerre ont à peu près la même puissance technologique et le même nombre d'hommes, l'armée la plus entraînée est généralement victorieuse. Des écoles et académies militaires existent dans le monde entier ; elles ont été créées afin d'assurer l'entraînement du personnel militaire aux méthodes, tactiques et technologies les plus récentes. Les hommes et femmes diplômés de ces établissements disposent généralement de capacités de commandement et de compétences militaires et technologiques supérieures à la moyenne, les rendant plus efficaces au combat.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Kriegerische Auseinandersetzungen hat es im Verlauf der menschlichen Geschichte bis zur Gegenwart gegeben. Wenngleich sich niemand einen Krieg wünscht, ist es dennoch wichtig, dass selbst die friedfertigsten Völker auf einen möglichen Kriegsausbruch vorbereitet sind. Wenn zwei Krieg führende Nationen über das gleiche technologische und militärische Potenzial verfügen, so ist für den Ausgang einzelner Gefechte in der Regel ausschlaggebend, wer die besser ausgebildeten Streitkräfte aufzuweisen hat. Militärschulen und -akademien, die militärisches Personal in den modernsten Militärtaktiken und -technologien unterweisen, existieren in allen Ländern der Welt. Die Absolventen besitzen nicht nur überdurchschnittliches Fachwissen, sondern verfügen auch über weit reichende militärische und technologische Fertigkeiten, die ihnen in Gefechtssituationen zugute kommen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Le guerre sono un fenomeno che ha interessato e continua a interessare la storia dell'uomo; è quindi importante che anche le società più pacifiche siano preparate a questo evento. Nel caso in cui due nazioni nemiche si trovino ad avere un livello tecnologico simile, è la preparazione dei soldati a fare la differenza. Le scuole e le accademie militari sono diffuse in tutto il mondo e hanno lo scopo di preparare le reclute agli equipaggiamenti e alle tecniche più avanzate. Coloro che si diplomano in questi luoghi possiedono abilità militari e cognizioni tattiche di alto livello, che li rendono più efficaci in situazioni di combattimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La guerra ha sido un fenómeno recurrente a lo largo de la historia de la humanidad y sigue atormentándola en la actualidad. Aunque no es una situación deseable, es importante que hasta las más pacíficas sociedades estén preparadas para la posibilidad de que se produzca un conflicto así. Cuando las naciones en guerra se encuentran igualadas en tecnología y mano de obra, el ejército mejor entrenado es el que suele ganar las batallas. Las escuelas y academias militares existen en todos los lugares del mundo, creadas con el propósito de entrenar al personal en los métodos, tácticas y tecnologías más modernos. Los hombres y mujeres que se gradúan en estas instituciones poseen habilidades de mando, tecnológicas y militares por encima de lo normal, lo que les proporciona mayor efectividad en combate.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Sultan Ahmed Mosque is a historical mosque in Istanbul, the largest city in Turkey and the capital of the Ottoman Empire from 1453 to 1923. The mosque is popularly known as the Blue Mosque for the blue tiles adorning the walls of its interior. It was built between 1609 and 1616, during the rule of Ahmed I. Like many other mosques, it also comprises a tomb of the founder, a madrasah and a hospice.[PARAGRAPH:1]The design of the Sultan Ahmed Mosque is the culmination of two centuries of both Ottoman mosque and Byzantine church development. It incorporates some Byzantine elements of the neighboring Hagia Sophia with traditional Islamic architecture and is considered to be the last great mosque of the classical period. The architect has ably synthesized the ideas of his master Sinan, aiming for overwhelming size, majesty and splendour.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]A bomb shelter is a structure designed to protect the people inside from falling bombs. Today's bomb shelters are designed to shield one from the destruction of a nuclear attack. People have constructed bomb shelters since the first artillery piece was put into action. Sometimes these are rude caves dug in a hillside; sometimes they are elaborate and complicated affairs, self-sustaining for weeks, dug hundreds of feet below the surface.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the 1950s during the Cold War, American citizens began constructing bomb shelters in their back yards and basements, hoping to avoid destruction during the atomic war they were sure was coming. The US government embarked on an ambitious program to create large bomb shelters in all major cities, stocking them with food, water, blankets, and other essential supplies. These are mostly abandoned today, probably because of the realization that most of them are not strong enough to do much good in the event of a nuclear attack.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un abri antiaérien est une structure permettant à la population de s'y réfugier pour se protéger des attaques par bombes. Les abris antiaériens actuels sont conçus pour résister à une attaque nucléaire. Depuis l'introduction des premières pièces d'artillerie, les populations ont construit des abris antiaériens. Parfois, il s'agit de simples grottes creusées à flanc de coteau mais ces abris peuvent aussi être des constructions élaborées et complexes, permettant de subsister pendant des semaines et construites à plusieurs mètres sous terre.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dans les années 1950, pendant la guerre froide, les citoyens américains ont commencé à construire des abris dans les jardins et dans les caves, espérant ainsi échapper à la destruction lors de la guerre nucléaire qu'ils étaient sûrs de voir se déclencher. Le gouvernement américain s'est alors engagé dans un ambitieux programme de création de grands abris dans toutes les grandes villes, les approvisionnant en nourriture, eau, couvertures et autres réserves indispensables. La plupart d'entre eux sont désormais abandonnés, sans doute parce qu'ils ne seraient pas suffisamment efficaces dans le cas d'une attaque nucléaire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Luftschutzkeller schützen die darin versammelten Menschen vor Bombenangriffen. Moderne Luftschutzkeller wurden entwickelt, um Menschen im Fall eines Atomangriffs zu schützen. Die ersten Luftschutzkeller entstanden mit dem ersten Einsatz von Artillerie. Manchmal handelt es sich nur um in Hügel gegrabene Höhlen; manche sind ausgefeilte komplexe Anlagen hunderte Meter unter der Oberfläche, die wochenlang autark sein können.[PARAGRAPH:1]In den 50er Jahren des 20. Jahrhunderts entstanden in unzähligen amerikanischen Gärten und Kellern Luftschutzkeller, als die Menschen versuchten, sich vor den Folgen eines möglichen Atomschlags zu schützen. Die amerikanische Regierung ließ damals in allen Großstädten Luftschutzkeller bauen und diese mit Lebensmitteln, Wasser, Decken und lebensnotwendigen Vorräten ausstatten. Heute sind die meisten Luftschutzkeller verlassen, da sie einem Atomangriff nicht standhalten würden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un rifugio antiaereo è una struttura pensata per proteggere le persone all'interno dai bombardamenti. I rifugi odierni sono stati realizzati in maniera tale da sopravvivere in caso di attacco nucleare. Le popolazioni hanno cominciato a costruire rifugi dai tempi della prima unità di artiglieria: molto spesso si trattava di caverne scavate sul lato di una collina, in altri casi invece si trattava di strutture più complesse, con autonomia di settimane, posizionate a centinaia di metri nel sottosuolo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Negli anni '50, durante la Guerra Fredda, i cittadini Americani cominciarono a costruire dei rifugi nei propri cortili e nelle cantine, nella speranza di evitare la distruzione durante l'imminente, presunta, guerra nucleare. Il governo degli USA avviò un programma ambizioso per la realizzazione di grandi rifugi nel cuore delle grandi città, forniti di cibo, acqua, coperte e altre scorte fondamentali. Al giorno d'oggi, la maggior parte di questi rifugi è abbandonata, probabilmente perché vennero costruiti in modo tale da non poter reggere un eventuale attacco nucleare.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Un refugio antiaéreo es una estructura diseñada para proteger a la gente de las bombas. En la actualidad pueden proteger incluso de una detonación nuclear. La gente ha construido refugios desde que aparecieron los primeros cañones. A veces son toscas cuevas excavadas en la ladera de una colina; otras, son complejos elaborados y sofisticados, capaces de sustentar a sus moradores durante semanas, a cientos de metros de la superficie.[PARAGRAPH:1]En la década de los 50, durante la Guerra Fría, la ciudadanía americana empezó a construir refugios en sus jardines y sótanos, para escapar a la destrucción de la guerra nuclear que, desde su punto de vista, era inevitable. El gobierno norteamericano se embarcó en un ambicioso programa destinado a crear grandes refugios en todas las ciudades importantes, donde se almacenó comida, agua, mantas y otros artículos esenciales. En la actualidad, la gran mayoría han sido abandonados, probablemente porque ha quedado constatado que no son lo bastante sólidos como para sobrevivir a un ataque nuclear.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Borobudur is an 8th-century Mahayana Buddhist monument near Magelang, Central Java, Indonesia. The monument comprises six square platforms topped by three circular platforms, and is decorated with 2,672 relief panels and 504 Buddha statues. A main dome, located at the center of the top platform, is surrounded by 72 Buddha statues seated inside perforated stupa.[PARAGRAPH:1]The monument is both a shrine to the Lord Buddha and a place for Buddhist pilgrimage. The journey for pilgrims begins at the base of the monument and follows a path circumambulating the monument while ascending to the top through the three levels of Buddhist cosmology, namely Kamadhatu (the world of desire), Rupadhatu (the world of forms) and Arupadhatu (the world of formlessness). During the journey, the monument guides the pilgrims through a system of stairways and corridors with 1,460 narrative relief panels on the walls and the balustrades.[PARAGRAPH:1]Evidence suggests Borobudur was abandoned following the 14th-century decline of Buddhist and Hindu kingdoms in Java, and the Javanese conversion to Islam. Worldwide knowledge of its existence was sparked in 1814 by Sir Thomas Stamford Raffles, then the British ruler of Java, who was advised of its location by native Indonesians. Borobudur has since been preserved through several restorations. The largest restoration project was undertaken between 1975 and 1982 by the Indonesian government and UNESCO, following which the monument was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Borobudur is still used for pilgrimage; once a year Buddhists in Indonesia celebrate Vesak at the monument, and Borobudur is Indonesia's single most visited tourist attraction.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]Brandenburg Gate is a former city gate and one of the main symbols of Berlin and Germany. It is located west of the city center at the intersection of Unter den Linden and Ebertstraße, immediately west of the Pariser Platz. It is the only remaining gate of a series through which one formerly entered Berlin. One block to the north stands the Reichstag. The gate is the monumental entry to Unter den Linden, the renowned boulevard of linden trees which formerly led directly to the city palace of the Prussian monarchs. It was commissioned by King Frederick William II of Prussia as a sign of peace and built by Karl Gotthard Langhans from 1788 to 1791. The Brandenburg Gate was restored from 2000 to 2002 by the Stiftung Denkmalschutz Berlin (Berlin Monument Conservation Foundation). Today, it is considered one of Europe's most famous landmarks.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Das Brandenburger Tor in Berlin steht am Pariser Platz in der Dorotheenstadt im Ortsteil Mitte (Bezirk Mitte). Es wurde in den Jahren von 1788 bis 1791 auf Anweisung des preußischen Königs Friedrich Wilhelm II. von Carl Gotthard Langhans errichtet und ist das bekannteste Wahrzeichen der Stadt. Zugleich ist das Tor ein nationales Symbol, mit dem viele wichtige Ereignisse der Geschichte Berlins, Deutschlands, Europas und der Welt des 20. Jahrhunderts verbunden sind. Der Bau ist dem frühklassizistischen Stil zuzuordnen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Mit dem Bau der Zollmauer der Stadt Berlin wurde 1734 ein Vorgängerbau des heutigen Brandenburger Tores als Stadttor an der Straße nach Brandenburg an der Havel errichtet. Die Toranlage bestand aus Pylonen und beigeordneten Wachhäusern. Im Zuge des Ausbaus der Mauer und ihrer Tore ließ Friedrich Wilhelm II. ab 1788 das Brandenburger Tor neu gestalten, das dem Andenken an den Krieg des kurz zuvor verstorbenen Friedrich II. diente, von dessen Verdiensten auch etwas Glanz auf den Neffen und Nachfolger fallen sollte.[PARAGRAPH:2]Als Architekt wurde Carl Gotthard Langhans beauftragt. Er orientierte sich an dem "Stadttor von Athen", das er aus Stichen von Leroy, Stuart und Revett kannte, die aber die Propyläen der Athener Akropolis abgebildet hatten. Das Eingangstor zur Akropolis war im dorischen Stil des Parthenon gehalten, um eine optische Einheit zu bilden. Das Tor hatte eine breite Mittelöffnung und zwei schmale Seiteneingänge für Fußgänger. Im rechten Winkel dazu standen zwei Seitenflügel. Nach Langhans Planung sollten entsprechend beim Berliner Tor durch den breiten Mittelgang die königlichen Kutschen, daneben die sonstigen Gespanne fahren und außen die Fußgänger gehen. In den Seitenflügeln sollten die Wache und die Akziseeinnehmer untergebracht werden. 1788 wurde das alte Tor abgerissen, eine große Baugrube ausgehoben und fundamentiert. 1789 wurde der Neubau begonnen. Die Baukosten lagen bei 111.000 Talern. Am 6. August 1791 wurde das noch nicht ganz fertige Tor geöffnet.[PARAGRAPH:2]Die 1793 von Johann Gottfried Schadow gefertigte Quadriga auf dem Brandenburger Tor stellte ursprünglich nach der wohl überwiegend vertretenen Auffassung eine geflügelte Friedensbringerin dar. Das Brandenburger Tor erhielt den Namen Friedenstor, diesen Namen zeigte auch eine Inschrift aus Bronzelettern am Tor. Diese Sinngebung interpretiert auch der bildliche Schmuck. Die Entwürfe für die Reliefs wurden vorwiegend von dem Maler und Akademiedirektor Christian Bernhard Rode angefertigt. Schadow hat die Entwürfe überarbeitet und die Steinmetze bei der Ausführung beaufsichtigt. Die Göttin in der Quadriga wird durch das Relief auf der Attika der Stadtseite als Friedensbringerin erklärt. Das Attikarelief steht unter dem Thema "Der Zug der Friedensgöttin". Im Zentrum des Reliefs über dem Mittelgang stehen Sinnbilder auf Frieden und Freundschaft. Die Friedensgöttin Eirene steht auf der äußersten Kante eines Triumphwagens. Mit der Rechten stützt sie sich auf den mit einer Lorbeergirlande geschmückten Rand des Wagens. In der einen Hand hält sie einen Palmenzweig, in der anderen einen Lorbeerkranz. Ihr Wagen wird von vier Eroten gezogen. Weiter rechts auf dem Attikarelief kann man Nike mit Flügeln und Tropaion erkennen.[PARAGRAPH:2]Direkt über diesem Relief steht die Quadriga Schadows. Deren göttliche Wagenlenkerin ist Nike und Eirene in einer Person. Nach einer abweichenden Auffassung soll es sich von Anfang an um eine "Siegesgöttin" gehandelt haben, unter anderem weil davon bereits im Vertrag zur Anfertigung der Figurengruppe vom 22. Juli 1789 die Rede gewesen sei. Schadow hatte ursprünglich für die Wagenlenkerin keine Trophäe entworfen. Ihm schwebte mehr die griechische Eirene als Friedensgöttin vor, als die römische Siegesgöttin Viktoria. 1793 verlangte dann aber ein Akademiebeschluss eine Kopie der Siegestrophäe der Nike rechts auf dem Attikarelief auch für die Wagenlenkerin der Quadriga. Bei der Bevölkerung fand sie keinen Zuspruch. Aufgrund heftiger Kritik besserte Schadow noch ein weiteres Mal nach. Das Tropaion wurde nun durch eine Lanze mit einem Lorbeerkranz und einem römischen Adler ersetzt. Außerdem erhielt die knapp bekleidete Wagenlenkerin nun ein bis auf den Boden reichendes Gewand.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In the mid-19th century, Brazil had been undergoing an economic transformation brought about by a new export crop: coffee. Coffee provided a new basis for agricultural expansion in southern Brazil. In the provinces of Rio de Janeiro and then São Paulo, coffee estates, or fazendas, began to spread toward the interior as new lands were opened. By 1850, coffee made up more than 50% of Brazil's exports, and more than half of world coffee production.[PARAGRAPH:1]Along with the expansion of coffee growing came an intensification of slavery in Brazil, as the country's primary form of labor. More than 1.4 million Africans were forced to be slaves in Brazil in the last 50 years of the slave trade, and even after the trans-Atlantic slave trade ended, slavery continued until 1888.[PARAGRAPH:1]Because of the increased profit from the trade of coffee, the years after 1850 saw considerable growth and prosperity in Brazil. Dom Pedro II proved to be an enlightened man of middle-class habits who was anxious to reign over a tranquil and progressive nation, even if that tranquility was based on slave labor. Railroads, steamships and the telegraph were introduced to Brazil, all paid for by the money the fazendas supplied from their coffee crop. In growing cities such as Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo, merchants, lawyers, a middle class, and an urban working class grew, once again paid for by the money coming from the fazendas.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]A chaitya is a Buddhist shrine or prayer hall with a stupa at one end. Chaityas were constructed to hold large numbers of devotees and to provide shelter for them. Early chaityas were built as standing structures with the stupa being surrounded by a colonnaded processional path enclosed by an outer wall with a congregation hall adjoining it. The more spectacular and more numerous chaityas, however, were cut into living rock as caves.

Chaityas wurden errichtet, um eine gro�e Anzahl von Gl�ubigen aufnehmen zu k�nnen. Fr�he Chaityas wurden als stehende Bauwerke errichtet, in denen die Stupa von s�ulenumgebenen Prozessionspfad innerhalb der �u�eren Mauer umgeben ist, und an die eine Versammlungshalle anschlie�t. Die spektakul�reren und zahlreicheren Chaityas wurden allerdings als H�hlen in lebendigen Fels gehauen.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A monastery is a building where monks can retreat from the world and concentrate upon the divine. Usually a monastery will have strict rules of conduct to protect its unworldly members from temptation. In some monasteries, the monks are totally silent; in others no visitors are allowed inside. Monasteries usually have many daily rituals and religious services.[PARAGRAPH:1]Throughout the ages monasteries have often been centers of learning. In remote areas the monks may be the only literate people for miles around. Monks have often been employed as scribes, copying out the words of their religion's sacred scripture. Monasteries frequently have extensive libraries, holding religious, scientific, medical and philosophical texts.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sanghas, alternately also called Viharas, were originally created to provide places for the wandering Buddhist monks to make their annual retreats. Some Buddhist monks stay indoors during the three-month rainy season to avoid damaging new plant growth (and to avoid being stranded during inclement weather). In the past, wealthy supporters donated plots of land where the monks could retreat; over time these have evolved into monasteries, often large and wealthy structures where monks can live year round.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]Located near Patna, in Bihar state, India, the Mahabodhi is a Buddhist temple in Bodh Gaya, the place where, according to Buddhist tradition, Siddhartha Gautama gained enlightenment and became the Buddha while meditating under a Bodhi (Peepal) tree.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Emperor Asoka constructed the "Golden Throne" sometime around 250 BC, and over time many other buildings and statues were added. In the 12th century the area was overrun by Muslims, and the temple sacked and largely destroyed. In the 16th century a Hindu monastery was established, and the monastery's abbot was given control over the temple grounds.[PARAGRAPH:1]Eventually the area came under British control. In the 1880s they began a major restoration of the temple, much against the wishes of the Hindu abbot. In the 1940s control over the site was given to the state, which manages the site with the advice of a committee containing Buddhists from the world over.[PARAGRAPH:1]A building of remarkable beauty and grandeur, the Mahabodhi is one of the oldest surviving brick buildings in India. Standing on the ruins of an even older "stupa," the temple consists of a high central tower surrounded by four smaller towers. The central tower rises some 60 feet in height. The edifice is covered by ornate and colorful molding, pilasters (pseudo columns), and arches, many of which contain bas relief sculptures. Inside sits a very large gilded statue of the Buddha. The statue sits where, legend has it, the Buddha was sitting when he achieved enlightenment.[PARAGRAPH:1]Near to the building stands a mighty Bodhi tree, a descendant of the one under which Buddha found enlightenment. The temple stands within an extensive complex of smaller temples, statues, and pathways running through beautiful parklands and alongside peaceful lakes. The temple and its surroundings remain a focus of Buddhist worship, and people from across the world come every year to honor the Buddha and to marvel at the beauty of the Mahabodhi.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Situé près de Patna dans l'état du Bihar en Inde, le temple de la Mahabodhi est un temple bouddhiste du site de Bodh Gaya où, selon la tradition bouddhiste, Siddhartha Gautama est parvenu à l'éveil et est devenu le Bouddha après avoir médité sous un arbre de la Bodhi ou Pipal (Ficus religiosa).[PARAGRAPH:1]L'empereur Ashoka construit le "trône de diamant" vers 250 av. J.-C. et au fil du temps, beaucoup d'autres édifices et statues sont ajoutés. Au XIIe siècle, la région est envahie par les musulmans et les temples sont saccagés et, en grande partie, détruits. Au XVIe siècle, un monastère hindou est fondé et le mahant, son dirigeant, est chargé de contrôler les terrains abritant le temple.[PARAGRAPH:1]La région passe ensuite sous contrôle britannique et dans les années 1880, les Britanniques commencent une grande restauration du temple à l'encontre du mahant hindou. Dans les années 1940, la protection du site est confiée à l'Etat qui le gère avec les conseils d'un comité composé de bouddhistes du monde entier.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le Mahabodhi, à la beauté remarquable et au caractère grandiose, est l'un des plus vieux bâtiments de brique en Inde. S'élevant au milieu des ruines d'un "stupa" encore plus vieux, le temple consiste en une haute tour centrale de 18 m entourée de quatre tours plus petites.
