TEXT.German: [TAB]Unter ungarischem Einfluss fanden die Husaren zunächst als leichte Kavallerie Eingang in das polnische Heer. Der Wandel zur schweren Reiterei, die das mittelalterliche Ritteraufgebot ersetzte, fand Ende des 16. Jahrhunderts unter König Stefan Batory seinen vorläufigen Abschluss. Die gepanzerten polnischen Flügelhusaren (Hussaria) trugen Brustpanzer, Armschienen und kniehohe Lederstiefel. Der Name geht auf die zwei am Rückenpanzer befestigten großen Flügelstangen zurück, die bis zu einem Meter über dem Kopf aufragten. Sie sollten die galoppierenden Husaren durch ihr Rauschen und Aussehen besonders furchteinflößend erscheinen lassen. Außerdem schützten sie den Rücken vor Säbelhieben und wehrten die von den feindlichen Tataren verwendeten Fanglassos ab. Mit der Lanze als Hauptwaffe ausgerüstet, trugen die Flügelhusaren ihre Attacken in geschlossener Formation vor. Neben dieser schweren Schlachtenkavallerie hielten sich, in Ungarn wie in Polen, leicht bewaffnete Husaren als Aufklärungstruppe. Deren Taktik und Ausrüstung wurden seit Beginn des 17. Jahrhunderts europaweit kopiert.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Husaren waren in Fähnlein (poln. Choragwie) von 210 Reitern eingeteilt. Die Aufstellung erfolgte überwiegend dreigliedrig, wobei das erste Glied von den Adligen (Towarzysz) und das zweite Glied von seinen Knappen (Pacholek), die ebenfalls aus dem niedrigen Adel stammten, besetzt war. Jede Einheit wurde von einem Rittmeister (Rotmistrz) im Range eines Oberst und seinem Stellvertreter (Porucznik) geführt. Weiter hatte jede Einheit eine Choragiew-Fahne, zwei Pauker und zwei Trompeter. Nur der König führte einen Roßschweif gekrönt von einem Falkenflügel. Hochadlige Anführer durften als Auszeichnung einen Roßschweif ohne Falkenflügel führen.

In molti battaglie polacco - lituano ussari sarebbe rivelato un fattore importante contro la stragrande quota.[PARAGRAPH:1]La principale battaglia tattica del Polacco-Lituana ussari era l'accusa. Essi hanno anche la tendenza a ripetere la carica fino a quando il nemico formazione rotto. TEXT.English: [TAB]Waka taua (war canoes) are large canoes manned by up to 80 paddlers and are up to 40 metres in length. Large waka, such as Nga Toki Matawhaorua which are usually elaborately carved and decorated, consist of a main hull formed from a single hollowed-out log, along with a carved upright head and tailboard. The gunwale is raised in some by a continuous plank which gives increased freeboard and prevents distortion of the main hull components when used in a rough seas. Sometimes the hull is further strengthened, as in the case of Te Winika, a 200-year-old design, by a batten or stringer running lengthwise both inside and outside the hull just above the loaded waterline. The resurgence of Maori culture has seen an increase in the numbers of waka taua built, generally on behalf of a tribal group, for use on ceremonial occasions.[PARAGRAPH:1]Traditionally the war canoe was highly tapu. No cooked food was allowed in the craft and the waka had to be entered over the gunwales,not the bow or stern which were highly decorated with powerful symbols. Canoes were often painted with black or white with black representing death. The main color was red which stood for tapu. Sometimes a waka would be placed upright as a marker for a dead chief with the curved bottom of the hull carved. Maori told missionaries during the Musket wars that battles between waka took place at sea with the aim being to ram an enemy's waka amidships at high speed. The ramming vessel would ride up over the gunwale and either force it under water or cause it to roll over. The enemies were either killed, left to drown or captured to be used in cannibal feasts or as slaves if they were female. This description matches the attack on the ship's boat of Abel Tasman in Golden Bay in 1642 when a Maori catamaran rammed a cock boat and 4 Dutch sailors were killed.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]Qizilbash ("Crimson/Red Heads") is the label given to a wide variety of Shia Islamic militant groups that flourished in Anatolia and Kurdistan from the late 13th century onwards, some of which contributed to the foundation of the Safavid dynasty of Iran. The expression "Red Heads" is derived from their distinctive twelve gored crimson headwear, indicating their adherence to the twelve Ithna'ashari Imams and to Haydar Safavi, the spiritual leader (sheikh) of the Safaviyya movement. The Qizilbash were a coalition of many different peoples of predominantly (but not exclusively) Turkic-speaking Azerbaijani background, united in their adherence to the Safavid doctrine of Shiism.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Roman Legions, created during the early wars of the Republic and tested during the three Punic Wars against Carthage, were the fighting force that conquered and held the Roman Empire together for five centuries. Each legion was composed of 6000 men, divided into 60 smaller groups known as centuries. Nearly unstoppable on the attack, the legion was relatively weak on defense. The legion's demise as a military unit was accelerated by the destruction of Emperor Valens' army by gothic knights in the fourth century.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les légions romaines, créées lors des guerres de la République et mises à l'épreuve au cours des trois guerres puniques contre Carthage, sont la force militaire qui a permis à Rome de conquérir, puis de préserver son Empire pendant cinq siècles. Chaque légion se composait de 6 000 hommes, répartis en 60 unités appelées centuries. Quasiment invincible en attaque, la légion était relativement faible en défense. La disparition de la légion a été accélérée au IVe siècle par la défaite de l'armée de l'Empereur Valens contre la cavalerie des Goths.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die römischen Legionen wurden während der frühen Kriege der Republik Rom ins Leben gerufen und stellten ihr Können zuerst in den drei Punischen Kriegen gegen Karthago unter Beweis. Im Großen und Ganzen ist es letztlich ihnen zu verdanken, dass das Römische Reich ein derartig großes Territorium erobern und mehr als fünfhundert Jahre lang auch zusammenhalten konnte. Jede Legion bestand aus insgesamt 6.000 Mann, die sich in 60 kleinere Truppenverbände, die so genannten Zenturien, gliederten. Die Offensivkraft einer Legion war nahezu unübertroffen, allerdings wies ihre Verteidigung relativ große Schwächen auf. Ausschlaggebend für die endgültige Abschaffung der Legionen als Militäreinheiten war die Vernichtung der Armee des römischen Kaisers Valens durch die gotischen Ritter im 4. Jahrhundert.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Le Legioni Romane, create durante i primi anni della Repubblica e messe alla prova durante le tre Guerre Puniche contro Cartagine, rappresentavano la forza militare dell'Impero Romano, che durò la bellezza di cinque secoli. Ciascuna legione era composta da 6.000 uomini, divisi in 60 gruppi più piccoli, denominati centurie. La Legione era inarrestabile in attacco, ma debole quando si trattava di difendere. La fine di questa unità militare venne dichiarata con la distruzione dell'esercito dell'Imperatore Valente per mano dei cavalieri barbari, durante il quarto secolo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Las legiones romanas, creadas durante las primeras guerras de la República y puestas a prueba durante las tres Guerras Púnicas contra Cartago, eran las fuerzas bélicas que conquistaron y mantuvieron unido el Imperio Romano durante cinco siglos. Cada legión se componía de seis mil hombres, divididos en sesenta grupos más pequeños llamados centurias. Casi imparable cuando atacaba, la legión era relativamente débil en cuanto a defensa. El fin de la legión como unidad militar se aceleró por la destrucción del ejército del emperador Valentiniano por los caballeros godos en el siglo IV.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Daoshi refers to a priest in Taoism. According to legend, these Taoist recluses would practice alchemy and austerity in the mountains, with the aim of becoming xian, or immortal beings. The activities of the daoshi tend to be informed by materials which may be found in the Daozang, or Taoist canon; however, daoshi generally choose, or inherit, specific texts which have been passed down for generations from teacher to student, rather than consulting published versions of these works. Daoshi practices can include various ceremonies, including fortune telling.[PARAGRAPH:1]Today there are two dominant priesthoods. The Quanzhen School, which is dominant in the northern half of the People's Republic of China, have priests that resemble Buddhist monks in that they are celibate, vegetarian, and live in temples. One of the most renowned locations is the White Cloud Temple in Beijing.[PARAGRAPH:1]The other main priesthood is the Zhengyi Tao, in which the priests can marry, eat meat, and live in their own homes. They are mostly priests part-time and can hold other jobs. They are present all over China, although with different names according to the local lineages. For example, in northern China there are the yinyang masters of the Lingbao sub-tradition.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Immortals were a strong corps deployed by the Persian Empire in the fifth century BC. Gifted soldiers, they drew their moniker from the fact that regardless of the casualties sustained in battle, the unit was restored to full strength, no matter the cost. Equipped with bow and spear, the front rank would advance upon the enemy while rear ranks rained arrows to ease the assault.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les Immortels étaient les soldats lourde de l'Empire Perse, au Ve siècle av. J.-C. Combattants hors pair, ils doivent leur nom au fait que leur unité était systématiquement reconstituée après la bataille, quelles qu'aient été les pertes. Equipés d'arcs et de lances, les soldats des premiers rangs avançaient sur l'ennemi tandis que ceux des derniers rangs faisaient pleuvoir les flèches pour faciliter l'attaque.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Diese Krummsäbelkämpfer wurden im 5. Jahrhundert vor Christus im Persischen Reich. Es handelte sich hierbei um hochbegabte Kämpfer, die ihren Spitznamen "die Unsterblichen" der Tatsache verdankten, dass ihre Reihen ungeachtet aller Verluste, die sie auf dem Schlachtfeld erleiden mochten, stets wieder vollständig aufgefüllt wurden, koste es, was es wolle. Während die vorderen Kampfreihen mit Speeren bewaffnet gegen den Feind vorrückten, ließen die hinteren Reihen Pfeile auf den Gegner hageln, um ihren Kameraden den Nahkampf zu erleichtern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli immortali erano un forte corpo, sviluppato dall'Impero Persiano nel quinto secolo a. C. Soldati di grande talento, gli immortali derivavano il loro soprannome dal fatto che, a prescindere dalle perdite riportate in battaglia, l'unità era riportata alla sua forza massima, senza badare al costo. Equipaggiata con arco e lancia, la fila anteriore avanzava verso il nemico, mentre quelle posteriori lanciavano nugoli di frecce per facilitare l'assalto.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los inmortales eran una potente unidad creada por el imperio persa en el siglo V a. C. Estos soldados de enorme valía extraían su sobrenombre del hecho de que, al margen de las bajas sufridas y del coste, la fuerza del regimiento se restauraba en su totalidad al finalizar la batalla. Equipados con arco y lanza, la primera fila avanzaba sobre el enemigo mientras las posteriores allanaban su ataque descargando una lluvia de flechas.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A submarine is a submersible warship, designed to attack enemy vessels while remaining hidden underwater. Although defensively weak, submarines are feared because of their ability to make a stealthy approach and attack without warning. Often, the presence of a submarine is not detected until the first of the sub's torpedoes strikes its target. The Germans first used submarine warfare extensively during World War I.[PARAGRAPH:1]Developments after the war, such as sonar, made the submarine even more effective. During World War II, submarines were used extensively by all the world's naval powers. Today's submarines, in addition to their role as fast attack vessels, also carry nuclear weapons that can be fired from underwater positions just off the coast of an enemy country.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Un sous-marin est un navire de guerre submersible, conçu pour attaquer les bateaux ennemis tout en restant caché sous l'eau. Bien que peu équipés pour la défense, les sous-marins sont redoutés pour leur capacité à effectuer une approche discrète et à attaquer sans prévenir. Leur présence n'est souvent détectée que lorsqu'ils ont tiré leur première torpille. Ce sont les Allemands qui ont les premiers mené une guerre sous-marine intensive au cours de la Première Guerre mondiale.[PARAGRAPH:1]Après la guerre, un certain nombre d'inventions, comme le sonar, ont amélioré l'efficacité des sous-marins. Au cours de la Deuxième Guerre mondiale, toutes les puissances navales les ont utilisés massivement. Les sous-marins contemporains, outre leur rôle de navires d'attaque rapides, transportent des armes nucléaires qu'ils peuvent tirer sans faire surface à proximité des côtes ennemies.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Ein Unterseeboot ist ein tauchfähiges Kriegsschiff, das sich unbemerkt an feindliche Seefahrzeuge annähern und diese dann aus dem Schutz der Tiefe heraus unerwartet angreifen kann. Zwar besitzen U-Boote selbst keine allzu guten Verteidigungssysteme, dennoch haben sie das Überraschungsmoment ganz auf ihrer Seite und sind gerade deswegen so gefürchtet: Häufig bleibt die Anwesenheit eines Unterseebootes völlig unentdeckt, bis die ersten Torpedos auf ihr Ziel treffen. Die Deutschen setzten als erste Streitmacht während des 1. Weltkrieges umfassend U-Boote ein.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nach dem Krieg wurde die Effizienz der U-Boote durch technische Neuerungen wie das Sonar weiter gesteigert, und im 2. Weltkrieg unterhielten bereits alle Seemächte der Welt U-Boot-Flotten. Neben ihrer Funktion als schnelle und wendige Angriffseinheiten sind moderne Unterseeboote mittlerweile auch mit Atomwaffen ausgerüstet, die gegebenenfalls aus unterseeischen Stellungen in der Nähe feindlicher Küstengebiete abgeschossen werden können.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Un sottomarino è un natante in grado di rimanere immerso e quindi di attaccare le navi nemiche senza essere avvistato. Nonstante la sua debolezza in ambito difensivo, si tratta di un temibile avversario per la sua capacità di attaccare senza essere individuato visivamente; spesso infatti la presenza di un sottomarino non viene rilevata fino al momento dell'attacco.[PARAGRAPH:1]I primi sottomarini furono utilizzati dai Tedeschi durante la Prima Guerra Mondiale e già nel secondo conflitto lo sviluppo tecnologico e l'efficacia del mezzo lo portarono a essere utilizzato da tutti gli eserciti del mondo. Oggi esistono sommergibili nucleari in grado di lanciare missili atomici in prossimità delle coste del paese scelto come obiettivo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El submarino es un barco de guerra sumergible, ideado para atacar a barcos enemigos sin necesidad de emerger. Aunque desde el punto de vista defensivo son muy débiles, los submarinos son temibles a causa de su capacidad para acercarse sigilosamente y atacar sin previo aviso. A menudo, la presencia de un submarino no se detecta hasta que el primero de sus torpedos hace blanco. Los alemanes fueron los pioneros en el uso generalizado de los submarinos, durante la Primera Guerra Mundial.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ciertos descubrimientos posteriores a la guerra, como por ejemplo el sonar, aumentaron más la efectividad de los submarinos. En la Segunda Guerra Mundial, todas las potencias navales del mundo los emplearon exhaustivamente. Los submarinos modernos, además de operar como naves de ataque rápido, transportan cabezas nucleares que pueden disparar contra territorio enemigo sin necesidad de emerger.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Espionage or, casually, spying involves a government, company/firm or individual obtaining information considered secret or confidential without the permission of the holder of the information. Espionage is inherently clandestine, as it is taken for granted that it is unwelcome and in many cases illegal and punishable by law. It is a subset of "intelligence gathering", which otherwise may be conducted from public sources and using perfectly legal and ethical means. It is crucial to distinguish espionage from "intelligence" gathering, as the latter does not necessarily involve espionage, but often collates open-source information.[PARAGRAPH:1]Espionage is often part of an institutional effort by a government or commercial concern. However, the term is generally associated with state spying on potential or actual enemies primarily for military purposes. Spying involving corporations is known as industrial espionage.[PARAGRAPH:1]One of the most effective ways to gather data and information about the enemy (or potential enemy) is by infiltrating the enemy's ranks. This is the job of the spy (espionage agent). Spies can bring back all sorts of information concerning the size and strength of an enemy army. They can also find dissidents within the enemy's forces and influence them to defect. In times of crisis, spies can also be used to steal technology and to sabotage the enemy in various ways. Counterintelligence operatives can feed false information to enemy spies, protecting important domestic secrets, and preventing attempts at subversion. Nearly every country has very strict laws concerning espionage, and the penalty for being caught is often severe. However, the benefits that can be gained through espionage are generally great enough that most governments and many large corporations make use of it to varying degrees.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Concurrent with the development of a stealth fighter, aeronautical engineers began to apply stealth technology to a full-scale bomber. The B-1B bomber, which went into service in 1986 as a replacement for the B-52, incorporated some of these innovations. The radar signature of the B-1B was reduced to a mere one percent that of the B-52 due to its low cross-section and its minimal use of radar-reflective, hard-edged surfaces.[PARAGRAPH:1]Soon after the B-1B entered service, the U.S. Air Force commissioned Northrop to develop a true stealth bomber as an eventual replacement. First revealed to the public in 1988, the B-2 stealth bomber uses a flying wing design similar in shape to the F-117A stealth fighter. The flying wing design reduces the profile of the B-2 by incorporating its engines into the body of the plane. The engine exhausts and intakes are shielded to prevent infrared tracking. The B-2 also makes use of curved surfaces and radar-absorbing materials to enhance its "invisibility", and make it far less detectable than the B-1B. As of the late 1980s, it was announced that 132 B-2's would be constructed, and would enter service sometime in the 1990s.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Parallèlement au développement d'un chasseur furtif, les ingénieurs aéronautiques commencèrent à appliquer les technologies furtives à un bombardier. Le B-1B, entré en service en 1986 en remplacement du B-52, contenait certaines de ces technologies. Grâce à sa coupe basse et à la réduction des surfaces réfléchissantes, la taille de la signature radar d'un B-1B était cent fois moindre que celle d'un B-52.[PARAGRAPH:1]Peu après la mise en service du B-1B, la U.S. Air Force chargea Northrop de la mise au point d'un véritable bombardier furtif. Dévoilé au public en 1988, le bombardier furtif B-2 est une aile volante, sur le modèle du chasseur furtif F-117A. Le concept d'aile volante permet de rendre plus compacte la silhouette de l'avion en incorporant les moteurs dans le corps de l'appareil. Les prises d'air et les échappements des moteurs sont profilés pour réduire la signature infrarouge. Le B-2 utilise aussi des surfaces incurvées et des matériaux ne réfléchissant pas les ondes radars, ce qui permet d'améliorer sa "furtivité" et de le rendre beaucoup plus difficile à détecter que le B-1B. A la fin des années 1980s, il a été annoncé que 132 B-2 serait construits et qu'ils entreraient en service dans les années 1990.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Gleichzeitig mit der Entwicklung des Stealth-Jagdflugzeugs begannen Luftfahrtingenieure, die Stealth-Technologie auf einen herkömmlichen Bomber zu übertragen. Der B-1B-Bomber, der im Jahre 1986 an die Stelle des B-52 trat, nutzte bereits einige der daraus resultierenden Neuerungen. So konnte beispielsweise die Radarkennung des B-1B aufgrund seines geringen Querschnitts und der minimalen Verwendung radarreflektierender hartkantiger Oberflächen auf lediglich 1 Prozent des B-52 reduziert werden.[PARAGRAPH:1]Kurz nachdem der B-1B-Bomber in Dienst gestellt wurde, beauftragte die amerikanische Luftwaffe die Firma Northrop mit der Entwicklung eines echten Stealth-Bombers, der den B-1B ablösen sollte. Das Flügeldesign des B-2-Stealth-Bombers, der im Jahre 1988 erstmals der Öffentlichkeit präsentiert wurde, ähnelt der Flügelgestaltung des F-117A-Stealth-Kampfflugzeugs, wobei das Profil des B-2 durch die Unterbringung der Motoren im Flugkörper reduziert wird. Die Ansaugturbinen und die Abgasanlage des Motors sind abgeschirmt, um Ortung durch Infrarottechnologie zu verhindern. Darüber hinaus kommen beim B-2 auch gekrümmte Oberflächen und radarabsorbierende Materialien zum Einsatz, wodurch sich seine "Unsichtbarkeit" im Vergleich zum B-1B deutlich erhöht. Ende der 80er Jahre wurde bekannt gegeben, dass insgesamt 132 Exemplare des B-2-Stealth-Bombers gebaut und im Laufe der 90er Jahre in Betrieb genommen werden sollten.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli ingegneri aeronautici hanno sviluppato contemporaneamente le applicazioni della tecnologia stealth destinate a caccia e bombardieri. Il B-1B, entrato in servizio nel 1986 in sostituzione del B-52, incorpora alcune di queste innovazioni. La rilevabilità radar del B-1B è ridotta all'1%% rispetto a quella dei normali aerei, grazie al design particolare e all'utilizzo di superfici non radar-riflettenti.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dopo l'entrata in servizio di questo aereo, l'aeronautica degli Stati Uniti d'America ha ordinato alla Northrop lo sviluppo di un bombardiere completamente invisibile. Venne così costruito il B-2, presentato ufficialmente nel 1988, che ricorda nella forma il caccia F-117A Stealth. I motori dell'aereo sono incorporati nella fusoliera e gli scarichi sono schermati per evitare le emissioni infrarosse. Anche il B-2 impiega superfici curve e materiali non radar-riflettenti, che contribuiscono a rendere l'aereo invisibile, rendendolo meno rivelabile del B1-B. Verso la fine degli anni '80, venne annunciata la costruzione di 132 B-2, che sarebbero dovuti entrare in uso negli anni '90.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Paralelamente al desarrollo del caza invisible, los ingenieros aeronáuticos comenzaron a aplicar la tecnología de invisibilidad a un bombardero. El bombardero B-1B, que entró en servicio en 1986 en sustitución de los B-52, incorporaba algunos de estos avances. Gracias a su esbeltez y su perfil suavizado, que minimiza la reflexión de las señales de radar, la señal de radar del B-1B era cien veces inferior a la del B-52.[PARAGRAPH:1]Poco después de que el B-1B entrara en servicio, las fuerzas aéreas estadounidenses encargaron a Northrop el desarrollo de un auténtico bombardero invisible como reemplazo futuro. Hecho público en 1988, el bombardero invisible B-2 utiliza un diseño de ala voladora, similar al del caza invisible F-117. El diseño de las alas reduce el perfil del B-2 incorporando los motores a la estructura del avión. Las toberas de los motores y las entradas de aire están cubiertas, con el fin de confundir a las señales infrarrojas. El B-2 también utiliza superficies curvas y materiales que absorben las señales de los radares para aumentar su "invisibilidad", lo que lo hace incluso más difícil de detectar que el B-1B. A finales de la década de los 80, se anunció que se construirían 132 B-2, que serían incorporados al servicio a lo largo de la década siguiente.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Cholas excelled in foreign trade and maritime activity, extending their influence overseas to China and Southeast Asia. A fragmentary Tamil inscription found in Sumatra cites the name of a merchant guild Nanadesa Tisaiyayirattu Ainnutruvar (literally, "the five hundred from the four countries and the thousand directions"), a famous merchant guild in the Chola country. The inscription is dated 1088, indicating that there was an active overseas trade during the Chola period.[PARAGRAPH:1]Towards the end of the 9th century, southern India had developed extensive maritime and commercial activity, especially with the Chinese and Arabs. The Cholas, being in possession of parts of both the west and the east coasts of peninsular India, were at the forefront of these ventures. The Tang dynasty of China, the Srivijaya empire in the Malayan archipelago under the Sailendras, and the Abbasid Kalifat at Baghdad were the main trading partners.[PARAGRAPH:1]The trade with the Chinese was a very lucrative enterprise, and Trade guilds needed the king's approval and the license from the customs force/department to embark on overseas voyages for trade. The normal trade voyage of those day involved three legs of journey, starting with the Indian goods (mainly spices, cotton and gems) being shipped to China and in the return leg the Chinese goods (silk, incense,iron) were brought back to Chola ports. After some materials were utilized for local consumption, the remaining cargo along with Indian cargo was shipped to the Arabs. Traditionally, this involved transfer of material/cargo to many ships before the ultimate destination was reached.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]A mobad is a Zoroastrian cleric of a particular rank. Unlike a herbad (ervad), a mobed is qualified to serve as celebrant priest at the Yasna ceremony. A mobed is also qualified to train other priests.[PARAGRAPH:1]In general (lay) use, the term is also used as an honorific to denote any priest, of any rank. For instance, Hormizd I appointed Kartir moabadan-moabad, which is frequently translated as 'priest of priests', but more precisely indicates 'high priest of high priests'.[PARAGRAPH:1]Zoroastrian priests in India are required to be male, but women have been ordained in Iran and North America as a mobedyar, meaning a women mobed.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Zulu spearmen were warriors without peer in southern Africa, dispatching every force that they encountered until running up against the superior technology of the Europeans. The Zulus were organized for the first time by Shaka, who began forming spearmen into groups called "impi" even before he became the chief of his tribe. Impi warriors began training as early as the age of six, serving first as porters and servants, and when of age, the cadets were trained in the use of weapons. When Zulu males reached adulthood at age twenty, they would become full members of their warband.[PARAGRAPH:1]Zulu spearmen were expected to be able to outrun a horse, travel 50 miles a day on foot, and move silently through rough terrain. The difficult training that the Zulu warriors went through made them tougher and stronger than their opponents, who frequently outnumbered the Zulus in battle.[PARAGRAPH:1]When going into battle, the Zulu spearmen painted their faces with chalk and red ochre to make themselves more intimidating. They carried spears (called "ilkwa") made of wood with a long iron point. The ilkwa was a stabbing weapon, unlike its predecessor the javelin-like "assegai," which had been used for throwing. Along with the spear, Zulus would carry a medium-sized shield. As contact with Europeans became more frequent later in the nineteenth century, Zulu warriors also made use of muskets and rifles captured from the British, although the Zulus did not have the training to use them properly.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tactically, the soldiers of a Zulu impi often used Shaka's "bull horns" formation, which consisted a main force ("isifuba" or chest) and two wings on the sides ("izimpondo" or horns) designed to outflank the enemy. A fourth group of veterans would remain as a reserve in the rear.[PARAGRAPH:1]The Zulu spearmen formed an effective and highly-versatile army which proved to be almost invincible when facing other African forces. They traveled lightly and could move very fast (if not the 50 miles a day that they claimed), but they also packed enough force to disrupt heavy enemy formations. Shaka used hit-and-run techniques against the numerically-superior Ndwandwe in the 1820s and achieved complete victory in a series of engagements.[PARAGRAPH:1]However, the Zulu spearmen were no match for the Martini-Henry rifles and Maxim guns of the British army when they went to war in 1878. The technological rift could not be overcome with Zulu valor.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les porte-lances zoulous sont des guerriers hors pair du Sud de l'Afrique, qui l'emportent contre toutes les forces qu'ils rencontrent jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient confrontés à la technologie supérieure des Européens. Les Zoulous sont organisés pour la première fois par Chaka, qui commence à regrouper les porte-lances dans des groupes appelés "impis" avant même qu'il ne devienne le chef de cette tribu. Les guerriers impis commencent leur formation dès l'âge de six ans, servant d'abord de porteurs et de serviteurs. Devenus majeurs, les cadets s'entraînent à manier les armes. Lorsque les hommes zoulous atteignent l'âge adulte, à vingt ans, ils deviennent membres à part entière de leur groupe guerrier.[PARAGRAPH:1] Les porte-lances zoulous doivent être capables de dépasser un cheval, de marcher 80 km par jour et de se déplacer en silence sur des terrains escarpés. Le difficile entraînement auquel sont soumis les guerriers zoulous les rend plus résistants et plus forts que leurs ennemis, qui sont généralement plus nombreux que les Zoulous dans les batailles.[PARAGRAPH:1]Lorsqu'ils partent aux combats, les porte-lances zoulous se peignent le visage avec de la craie ou de l'ocre rouge pour être plus intimidants. Ils portent des lances de bois avec une longue pointe en fer, appelées "ilkwas". La ilkwa est une arme coupante, contrairement à l'arme qu'elle remplace, la "assegai", qui ressemblait à un javelot et devait être lancée. Outre la lance, les Zoulous portent un bouclier de moyenne taille. Au XIXe siècle, lorsqu'ils entrent plus souvent en contact avec les Européens, les guerriers zoulous utilisent également des mousquets et des fusils pris aux Britanniques, même s'ils ne savent pas les utiliser correctement.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sur le plan tactique, les soldats d'un impi zoulou utilisent souvent la formation en "tête de buffle", qui consiste en une force principale ("isifuba" ou poitrine) et deux ailes sur les côtés ("izimpondo" ou cornes) qui servent à déborder l'ennemi. Un quatrième groupe de vétérans reste en réserve à l'arrière.[PARAGRAPH:1] Les porte-lances zoulous forment une armée efficace et pleine de ressources qui se révèle presque invincible face aux autres forces africaines. Ils se déplacent avec peu d'équipement et peuvent avancer très vite, même s'ils ne font par les 80 km qu'ils prétendent parcourir. Ils disposent par ailleurs de forces suffisantes pour vaincre d'importantes formations ennemies. Dans les années 1820, Chaka utilise des techniques éclair contre les Ndwandwes, numériquement supérieurs, et parvient à remporter une victoire totale dans plusieurs combats.[PARAGRAPH:1]Cependant, les porte-lances zoulous sont trop faibles face aux fusils Martini-Henry et aux mitrailleuses Maxim de l'armée britannique, lorsqu'ils entrent en guerre en 1878. Le fossé technologique ne peut pas être comblé par la bravoure des Zoulous.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Speerkämpfer der Zulu waren die mit Abstand besten Krieger Südafrikas und schlugen bis zur Entwicklung überlegener Technologien durch die Europäer jede Streitmacht nieder, der sie begegneten. Die ersten Schritte in Richtung Kampfordnung erfuhren die Zulu durch ihren späteren Stammesführer Shaka, der die Speerwerfer in "Impi" genannte Regimenter ordnete. Die Ausbildung eines Impi-Kriegers begann im zarten Alter von sechs Jahren, wobei sie zunächst als Träger und dann als Diener eingesetzt wurden und erst, wenn sie alt genug waren, den Umgang mit Waffen erlernten. Sobald ein männlicher Zulu 20 Jahre alt wurde und damit als Erwachsener galt, wurde er als vollwertiges Mitglied in den Kampfverbund aufgenommen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Von den Speerkämpfern der Zulu wurde erwartet, dass sie ein Pferd ein- oder überholen, etwa 80 Kilometer pro Tag zu Fuß zurücklegen und sich auch auf rauem Gelände sehr leise fortbewegen konnten. Die schwierige Ausbildung, die ein Zulu-Krieger durchlaufen musste, härtete ihn zusehends ab und machte ihn stärker als seine Gegner, die den Zulu im Kampf häufig zahlenmäßig überlegen waren.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn sie ins Gefecht zogen, bemalten die Speerkämpfer der Zulu ihre Gesichter mit Kreide und Ockerfarbe, um noch Furcht einflößender zu wirken. Statt mit den früher verwendeten Wurfspießen (den "Assegai") waren die Krieger seit der von Shaka eingeführten militärischen Neuerungen nun mit Stoßspeeren (den so genannten "Iklwa") ausgestattet, die aus Holz gefertigt waren und eine lange eiserne Spitze besaßen. Außerdem führten sie mittelgroße Schilde bei sich. Als es im 19. Jahrhundert immer häufiger zu kriegerischen Auseinandersetzungen mit den Europäern kam, setzten die Zulu-Krieger auch die von den Briten erbeuteten Musketen und Gewehre ein, obwohl sie keinerlei Ausbildung im Umgang mit derartigen Waffen hatten.[PARAGRAPH:1]Taktisch wurden die Zulu-Krieger des Impi oftmals in Shakas "Büffelhorn"-Formation eingesetzt, die aus einer Hauptkampftruppe (den "Isifuba", zu Deutsch etwa Brustkorb) und zwei Flügeltruppen an den Flanken (den "Izimpondo", zu Deutsch etwa Hörner) bestand, wobei Letztere den Feind umzingeln sollten. Und schließlich bildete eine vierte Veteranentruppe an der Rückseite die Reserve.[PARAGRAPH:1]Die Speerkämpfer der Zulu stellten eine effiziente und höchst flexible Armee dar, die sich in Begegnungen mit anderen afrikanischen Streitmächten als nahezu unbesiegbar erwies. Sie waren nur leicht ausgerüstet und konnten sich sehr schnell fortbewegen (wenn auch nicht unbedingt immer die besagten 80 Kilometer am Tag), aber sie hatten stets genug Kraft, um selbst schwere feindliche Formationen auseinander sprengen zu können. Im Kampf gegen die zahlenmäßig überlegenen Truppen der Ndwandwe um 1820 wendete Shaka die "Hit and Run"-Taktik an und trug so in mehreren Gefechten den Gesamtsieg davon.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gegen die Martini-Henry-Gewehre und Maxim-Maschinengewehre, welche die britische Armee im Krieg von 1878 einsetzte, konnten die Speerkämpfer der Zulu allerdings nichts ausrichten - die technologische Kluft zwischen den beiden Kriegsparteien ließ sich auch durch die Tapferkeit der Zulu nicht überbrücken.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I lancieri zulu furono guerrieri senza pari nell'Africa meridionale, capaci di sconfiggere ogni avversario finché non si scontrarono con la superiorità tecnologica degli europei. Gli Zulu furono organizzati per la prima volta da Shaka, che cominciò a ordinare i lancieri in gruppi detti "impi" prima ancora di diventare il capo della sua tribù. I guerrieri impi iniziavano l'addestramento a sei anni, facendo prima da ausiliari e servitori ai soldati e poi, una volta diventati maturi, venendo addestrati all'uso delle armi. I maschi zulu raggiungevano la maggiore età a venti anni e solo allora diventavano membri della tribù a pieno titolo.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dai lancieri zulu si esigeva che sapessero superare un cavallo in corsa, che fossero in grado di percorrere 50 miglia al giorno a piedi e che sapessero spostarsi silenziosamente su terreni aspri. Il rigoroso addestramento rendeva i guerrieri zulu più resistenti e più forti dei nemici, che spesso superavano di numero i guerrieri zulu.[PARAGRAPH:1]Quando andavano in battaglia, i lancieri zulu si dipingevano il volto con gesso e ocra rossa per intimidire il nemico. Essi avevano con sé delle lance corte ("iklwa") fatte di legno con una lunga punta metallica. L'iklwa serviva a pugnalare e non a essere scagliata, a differenza del suo predecessore ("assegai") che era simile a un giavellotto. Oltre alla lancia, gli Zulu avevano uno scudo di medie dimensioni. Quando i contatti con gli europei diventarono più frequenti, i guerrieri zulu utilizzarono anche i moschetti e i fucili sottratti ai Britannici, anche se nessuno mai insegnò loro a utilizzarli in modo efficiente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Dal punto di vista tattico, un impi adottava spesso la formazione a "corna di bufalo", che era composta da un corpo centrale ("isifuba" o torso) e da due ali ai lati ("izimpondo" o corna) che dovevano aggirare il nemico. In retroguardia restava un gruppo di veterani come riserva.[PARAGRAPH:1]I lancieri zulu formavano un corpo molto efficiente e versatile e praticamente invincibile se opposto agli altri eserciti africani. Essi viaggiavano leggeri e veloci (anche se forse non raggiungevano le 50 miglia al giorno), ma un impi era abbastanza potente da scombussolare formazioni nemiche pesanti. Intorno al 1820 Shaka usò la tecnica del mordi e fuggi contro i più numerosi Ndwandwe e ottenne una vittoria completa dopo una serie di scontri.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tuttavia i lancieri zulu non potevano competere con i fucili Martini-Henry o con le pistole Maxim dell'esercito britannico quando le due fazioni si scontrarono nel 1878. Il divario tecnologico era troppo profondo persino per i valorosi Zulu.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los lanceros zulúes, guerreros sin igual en la zona de África del sur, derrotaron a todos los que se enfrentaron hasta topar con la superior tecnología de los europeos. Los zulúes fueron organizados por primera vez por Chaka, quien empezó a formarlos en unidades llamadas "impi" incluso antes de llegar a ser jefe de su tribu. Los guerreros impi empezaban a entrenarse a los seis años. Primero servían como porteadores y criados y, cuando llegaban a la edad necesaria, eran instruidos en el uso de las armas. Cuando los zulúes llegaban a la mayoría de edad (a los veinte años) se convertían en miembros de pleno derecho de sus unidades.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los lanceros zulúes debían ser capaces de correr más que un caballo, recorrer ochenta kilómetros al día a pie y viajar por terreno abrupto. Las dificultades que afrontaban durante su instrucción los hacían más duros y fuertes que sus adversarios, que muchas veces los superaban en número en el campo de batalla.[PARAGRAPH:1]Antes de las batallas, los lanceros zulúes se pintaban la cara de teja y ocre para parecer más amenazadores. Iban armados con lanzas (llamadas "ilkwas") de madera con una alargada punta de hierro. La ilkwa era un arma punzante de cuerpo a cuerpo, a diferencia de su predecesora, la "assegai" que era una especie de jabalina utilizada como arma arrojadiza. Junto con esta lanza, los zulúes llevaban un escudo de tamaño medio. A lo largo del siglo XIX, a medida que aumentaba su contacto con los europeos, los guerreros zulúes empezaron a hacer uso de los mosquetes y rifles capturados a los británicos, pero siempre carecieron de la instrucción necesaria para utilizarlos bien.[PARAGRAPH:1]Desde el punto de vista táctico, los soldados de los impis zulúes empleaban a menudo la formación de "los cuernos del búfalo", que consistía en un contingente principal ("isifuba" o pecho) y dos alas ("izimpondo" o cuernos), cuya tarea era envolver al enemigo. A veces, un cuarto grupo de veteranos permanecía en retaguardia como reserva.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los lanceros zulúes formaban un ejército eficaz y muy versátil que era casi invencible cuando se enfrentaba a otras fuerzas africanas. Viajaban con poca impedimenta y podían moverse muy deprisa (aunque puede que no tanto como los ochenta kilómetros que ellos decían) y, además, tenían la fuerza suficiente como para desbaratar formaciones pesadas enemigas. En la década de 1820, Chaka usó una táctica de incursiones y maniobras rápidas contra los ndwandwe, superiores en número, y alcanzó una victoria total tras una serie de batallas.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sin embargo, los lanceros zulúes no eran rival para los rifles Martini-Henry y las ametralladoras Maxim del ejército británico cuando se inició la guerra (1878). La bravura zulú no podía llenar el abismo de la diferencia tecnológica.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The gray wolf (Canis lupus), also known as the timber wolf, true wolf or western wolf is a canid native to the wilderness and remote areas of North America, Eurasia, and North Africa. It is the largest extant member of its family, with males averaging 43-45 kg (95-99 lb), and females 36-38.5 kg (79-85 lb). Like the red wolf, it is distinguished from other Canis species by its larger size and less pointed features, particularly on the ears and muzzle. Its winter fur is long and bushy, and predominantly a mottled gray in color, although nearly pure white, red, or brown to black also occur.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf is the most specialised member of the genus Canis, as demonstrated by its morphological adaptations to hunting large prey, its more gregarious nature, and its highly advanced expressive behavior. It is nonetheless closely related enough to smaller Canis species, such as the eastern wolf, coyote and golden jackal to produce fertile hybrids. It is the only species of Canis to have a range encompassing both the Old and New Worlds, and originated in Eurasia during the Pleistocene, colonizing North America on at least three separate occasions during the Rancholabrean. It is a social animal, travelling in nuclear families consisting of a mated pair, accompanied by the pair's adult offspring. The gray wolf is typically an apex predator throughout its range, with only humans and tigers posing a serious threat to it. It feeds primarily on large ungulates, though it also eats smaller animals, livestock, carrion, and garbage.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf is one of the world's best known and well researched animals, with probably more books written about it than any other wildlife species. It has a long history of association with humans, having been despised and hunted in most pastoral communities due to its attacks on livestock, while conversely being respected in some agrarian and hunter-gatherer societies. It is the sole ancestor of the dog, which genetic and paleontological records indicate was first domesticated in Europe 18,800-32,100 years ago by hunter-gatherers. Although the fear of wolves is pervasive in many human societies, the majority of recorded attacks on people have been attributed to animals suffering from rabies. Non-rabid wolves have attacked and killed people, mainly children, but this is unusual, as wolves are relatively few, live away from people, and have been taught to fear humans by hunters and shepherds.[PARAGRAPH:1]The gray wolf was once one of the world's most widely distributed mammals, living throughout the northern hemisphere north of 15°N latitude in North America and 12°N in India. However, deliberate human persecution has reduced the species' range to about one third, due to livestock predation and fear over attacks on humans. The species is now extinct in much of Western Europe, in Mexico and much of the USA. In modern times, the gray wolf occurs mostly in wilderness and remote areas, particularly in Canada, Alaska and northern USA, Europe, and Asia from about 75°N to 12°N. Wolf population declines have been arrested since the 1970s, and have fostered recolonization and reintroduction in parts of its former range, due to legal protection, changes in land-use and rural human population shifts to cities. Competition with humans for livestock and game species, concerns over the danger posed by wolves to people, and habitat fragmentation pose a continued threat to the species. Despite these threats, because of the gray wolf's relatively widespread range and stable population, it is classified as Least Concern by the IUCN.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The trebuchet was a medieval siege weapon designed to throw a projectile a great distance through the air. The trebuchet originated in China sometime between the fifth and third centuries BC. From there it spread to the west, reaching Europe around 500 AD.[PARAGRAPH:1]Although it is usually thought of as a type of catapult, the trebuchet is in fact a gigantic sling attached to a lever. The shorter arm of the lever carries a counterweight, while the longer arm carries the sling that throws the projectile. In operation the sling end is pulled towards the ground (lifting the counterweight in the process) and held in place by a trigger while a projectile is loaded into the sling. When the trigger is released, the counterweight falls and the sling flies up and above the machine, releasing the projectile at the top of its arc.[PARAGRAPH:1]Constructed properly, trebuchets could fire very heavy loads. In modern reconstructions using trebuchets built with the original tools and materials, trebuchets have been able to throw projectiles weighing as much as 300 kilograms. Aiming the trebuchet was difficult and required some practice and knowledge of engineering - both of which were usually in short supply for medieval operators. Trebuchets were also extremely heavy and almost immobile; this, combined with their slow rate of their fire, made them impractical for anything except siege operations.[PARAGRAPH:1]Although the Chinese were the first to develop the trebuchet, by the time of the Mongol invasions the Chinese had fallen behind other parts of the world in siege technology. This was due to the fact that China had been politically united for long periods of time, preventing the formation of strong fortresses across the country, and the traditional enemies of the Chinese were nomadic warriors - not fortified city-dwellers. Nevertheless, the Chinese were still far more advanced in siege warfare than the Mongols, and it was not until the Mongols adopted Chinese practices that they began to have success capturing enemy fortifications.[PARAGRAPH:1]Late in the conquest of Song China, Mongol leader Kublai Khan brought in Arab engineers from the Mongol holdings in Persia to build hinged counterweight trebuchets, which were more advanced than anything yet seen in China. With the aid of these powerful weapons, Kublai was able to take the previously-impenetrable fortress of Xiangyang in 1273, and from there rapidly take the rest of Song China's cities, completing his conquest of the Song Empire in 1279.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le trébuchet est une arme de siège médiévale, servant à lancer un projectile à une longue distance. Il est créé en Chine entre le Ve et le IIIe siècle av. J.-C., et se répand ensuite vers l'ouest, atteignant l'Europe vers 500 ap. J.-C.[PARAGRAPH:1]Bien qu'il soit généralement considéré comme une sorte de catapulte, le trébuchet est en fait une gigantesque fronde attachée à un levier. Le bras le plus court du levier comporte un contrepoids tandis que le bras le plus long contient la fronde qui lance le projectile. Lors de son utilisation, l'extrémité de la fronde est tendue vers le sol, ce qui soulève le contrepoids, et maintenue par une cheville pendant que le projectile est installé dans la fronde. Lorsque la cheville est relâchée, le contrepoids tombe, la fronde s'élève au-dessus de l'appareil et éjecte le projectile lorsqu'elle se trouve à son apogée.[PARAGRAPH:1]Construits correctement, les trébuchets peuvent projeter de très lourdes charges. Dans des reconstitutions modernes utilisant des trébuchets fabriqués avec les outils et matériaux d'origine, les trébuchets sont capables de lancer des projectiles pesant 300 kg. Il est difficile de manoeuvrer le trébuchet, cela requiert pratique et connaissance de l'ingénierie qui étaient toutes deux peu courantes pour les opérateurs médiévaux. Les trébuchets sont aussi extrêmement lourds et presque immobiles. Combinés à leur lente fréquence de tir, tous ces inconvénients le rendent inutilisable excepté pour les opérations de siège.[PARAGRAPH:1]Si les Chinois sont les premiers à avoir développé le trébuchet, à l'époque des invasions mongoles, ils sont vite dépassés par d'autres régions du monde en matière de technologie de siège. Cela s'explique par le fait que les Chinois ont été politiquement unifiés pendant très longtemps et n'ont donc pas eu besoin de construire de solides forteresses dans le pays. Par ailleurs, les ennemis traditionnels des Chinois sont des guerriers nomades qui ne vivent pas dans des cités fortifiées. Toutefois, les Chinois sont bien plus avancés que les Mongols pour la guerre de siège et ce n'est que lorsque ces derniers adoptent les pratiques chinoises qu'ils commencent à réussir à attaquer les fortifications ennemies.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tardivement, lors de la conquête de la Chine des Song, le leader mongol Kubilai Khan fait appel à des ingénieurs arabes, originaires de territoires perses détenus par les Mongols, pour construire des trébuchets à contrepoids articulé, qui sont bien plus avancés que tout ce qui existe alors en Chine. A l'aide de ces puissantes armes, Kubilai parvient à s'emparer de la forteresse autrefois imprenable de Xiangyang en 1273 et, de là, à s'approprier rapidement les autres villes de la Chine des Song, achevant sa conquête de l'Empire Song en 1279.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Tribok war eine mittelalterliche Belagerungswaffe, mit der Geschosse über große Entfernungen hinweg durch die Luft geschleudert wurden. Er wurde ursprünglich irgendwann zwischen dem 5. und 3. Jahrhundert vor Christus in China entwickelt. Von dort aus gelangte er immer weiter nach Westen und wurde um 500 nach Christus erstmals auch in Europa eingesetzt.[PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl er in der Regel wie eine Art Katapult beschrieben wird, handelt es sich bei dem Tribok tatsächlich um eine gigantische Schleuder mit einem Hebelmechanismus. An dem kürzeren Hebel ist ein Gegengewicht befestigt, während der längere Hebel die Schlinge steuert, die das Geschoss abfeuert. Im Betrieb wird das Schlingenende zu Boden gezogen (wobei das Gegengewicht angehoben wird) und mit einem Abzugshebel fixiert, während das Geschoss in die Schlinge geladen wird. Wird der Abzugshebel gelöst, fällt das Gegengewicht herunter, die Schlinge fliegt nach oben - über die Maschine hinweg - und das Geschoss wird dabei am höchsten Punkt der Schwungbogenbewegung herausgeschleudert.[PARAGRAPH:1]Wenn sie richtig konstruiert waren, konnten die Triboken mit sehr schweren Geschossen beladen werden. Moderne Nachbauten, für die originale Werkzeuge und Materialien verwendet wurden, haben gezeigt, dass Triboken Geschosse von bis zu 300 Kilogramm Gewicht aufnehmen können. Das Zielen war mit einem Tribok allerdings recht schwierig und erforderte einige Übung sowie technische Kenntnisse - und beides war bei den mittelalterlichern Bedienern dieser Waffen eher selten vorhanden. Außerdem waren Triboken extrem schwer und nahezu unbeweglich. Bedenkt man dann noch ihre geringe Schussfrequenz, waren sie wirklich ausschließlich für Belagerungsangriffe geeignet.[PARAGRAPH::1]Obwohl die Chinesen den Tribok als Erste entwickelt hatten, hinkten sie zur Zeit des Einmarschs der Mongolen den Belagerungstechnologien anderer Länder der Welt bereits weit hinterher. Der Grund hierfür war, dass China über lange Perioden hinweg politisch geeint war, wodurch die Errichtung starker Festungen im Land unnötig gewesen war. Zudem waren die traditionellen Feinde der Chinesen stets Nomadenkrieger gewesen und keine Bewohner befestigter Städte. Trotzdem waren die Chinesen den Mongolen in punkto Belagerungskriegsführung immer noch überlegen und erst nachdem die Mongolen Chinas Technologien übernommen hatten, waren sie auch in der Lage, feindliche Festungen einzunehmen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Gegen Ende der Belagerung des von der Song-Dynastie regierten China setzte der mongolische Herrscher Kublai Khan arabische Baumeister aus den mongolischen Ländereien in Persien ein, um klappbare Gegengewicht-Triboken zu bauen, die erheblich fortschrittlicher waren als die Triboken der Chinesen. Mithilfe dieser Waffen war Kublai Khan in der Lage, im Jahr 1273 die zuvor uneinnehmbare Festung Xiang-yang zu erobern und von dort aus innerhalb kurzer Zeit auch die übrigen Städte der Song-Dynastie einzunehmen, so dass er seinen Eroberungsfeldzug des Song-Reiches im Jahr 1279 vollenden konnte.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il trabocco era un'arma d'assedio medievale progettata per scagliare in aria proiettili a grandi distanze. Il trabocco nacque in Cina tra il quinto e il terzo secolo a.C.. Da lì il suo uso si diffuse verso ovest, raggiungendo l'Europa intorno al 500 d.C..[PARAGRAPH:1]Anche se di solito lo si pensa come una specie di catapulta, il trabocco è in realtà un'enorme fionda agganciata a una leva. Il braccio più corto della leva porta un contrappeso, mentre quello più lungo è collegato alla fionda con il proiettile. Quando è attivato, la fionda viene tirata verso il terreno (il contrappeso, per contro, si solleva) e tenuta in posizione da un grilletto mentre il proiettile viene caricato nella fionda. Quando il grilletto viene rilasciato, il contrappeso cade e la fionda vola sopra il trabocco, scagliando il proiettile nel punto più alto del suo arco.[PARAGRAPH:1]Se costruito correttamente, il trabocco poteva scagliare oggetti molto pesanti. Nelle moderne ricostruzioni con i materiali e le tecniche dell'epoca, si sono potuti scagliare pesi anche di 300 chili. Prendere la mira col trabocco era difficile e occorreva pratica e qualche nozione di ingegneria, cose che spesso mancavano a chi li manovrava nel Medioevo. I trabocchi erano anche estremamente pesanti e praticamente immobili; questo e la bassa frequenza dei colpi li rendevano utili solo negli assedi.[PARAGRAPH:1]Anche se furono i Cinesi i primi a svilupparlo, al tempo delle invasioni dei Mongoli la tecnologia per assedi cinese era ormai arretrata rispetto al resto del mondo e questo per via dell'unione politica di lunga durata, che aveva reso inutile la costruzione di grandi fortezze in tutto il Paese, e per via della natura dei loro nemici, che erano tribù nomadi e non cittadini residenti in centri fortificati. Ciò nonostante la tecnologia d'assedio cinese era più avanzata di quella dei Mongoli e fu solo quando questi ultimi adottarono le tecniche cinesi che riuscirono a dar loro del filo da torcere.[PARAGRAPH:1]In seguito, al momento di conquistare la Cina dei Song, il capo mongolo Kublai Khan portò con sé degli ingegneri arabi (provenienti dai possedimenti mongoli in Persia) affinché costruissero trabocchi muniti di cardini e contrappesi, molto più avanzati di qualsiasi arma vista prima in Cina. Fu grazie all'aiuto di queste potenti armi che Kublai riuscì a prendere l'altrimenti impenetrabile fortezza di Xiangyang nel 1273 e da lì partire alla conquista del resto della Cina, completata nel 1279.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El trabuquete era una máquina de asedio medieval diseñada para arrojar un proyectil a gran distancia. Se inventó en China, en algún momento entre los siglos V y III a. C. Desde allí se extendió hacia el oeste y llegó a Europa alrededor del año 500 d. C.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque suele pensarse que es un tipo de catapulta, el trabuquete es en realidad una gigantesca honda unida a una palanca. El brazo corto de la palanca lleva un contrapeso, mientras que el brazo largo propulsa la honda que lanza el proyectil. Para armarse, el brazo de la honda se baja hasta el suelo (levantando el contrapeso en el proceso) y se sujeta mediante un sistema de disparador mientras se carga el proyectil. Cuando se acciona el disparador, el contrapeso cae, la honda se eleva por encima de la maquinaria y, al llegar al cenit de su ascenso, suelta el proyectil.[PARAGRAPH:1]Si están bien construidos, los trabuquetes pueden lanzar proyectiles muy pesados. En reconstrucciones modernas de trabuquetes realizadas con las herramientas y los materiales de la época, se han llegado a lanzar proyectiles de hasta trescientos kilos. Apuntar con el trabuquete era difícil y requería práctica y conocimientos de ingeniería, habilidades que no abundaban demasiado en los artilleros medievales. Además, eran extremadamente pesados y casi inmóviles. Esto, combinado con su lenta cadencia de fuego, hacía que fuesen muy poco prácticos, salvo como máquinas de asedio.[PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque los chinos habían inventado esta máquina, en tiempos de las invasiones mongolas su tecnología de asedios había quedado rezagada con respecto a la de otras partes del mundo. En parte, esto se debía al hecho de que China llevaba mucho tiempo unificada políticamente, lo que había impedido la aparición de importantes fortalezas en su territorio, ya que los enemigos tradicionales de los chinos eran guerreros nómadas, no pueblos con ciudades fortificadas. No obstante, los chinos seguían estando muy por encima de los mongoles en cuanto a maquinaria de asedio y, hasta que los nómadas no empezaron a adoptar sus técnicas de poliorcética, no tuvieron ningún éxito en la captura de fortificaciones.[PARAGRAPH:1]En las fases finales de la conquista de la China Song, el líder mongol Kublai kan trajo ingenieros árabes de las posesiones mongolas en Arabia para que le construyeran grandes trabuquetes, más avanzados que cualquiera que se hubiese visto en China hasta la fecha. Con la ayuda de estas poderosas armas, Kublai fue capaz de tomar la hasta entonces inexpugnable fortaleza de Xiangyang en 1273 y, a partir de allí, el resto de la China Song, cuya conquista se culminó en 1279.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In medieval Scandinavia, Huscarls or housecarls were either non-servile manservants, or household troops in personal service of someone, equivalent to a bodyguard to Scandinavian lords and kings. This institution also existed in Anglo-Saxon England after its conquest by the kingdom of Denmark in the 11th century. In England, the royal housecarls had a number of roles, both military and administrative; they are well known for having fought under Harold Godwinson at the Battle of Hastings.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Dynasties of Siam and Thailand bred and kept their own trained elephants for war. War elephants were important, although not widespread, weapons in ancient military history. Their main use was in charges, to trample the enemy and/or break their ranks. Elephant taming began in the Indus Valley civilization around 4,000 years ago. The first species to be tamed was thus the Asian elephant, for agricultural ends. The first military application of elephants dates from around 1100 BC in northern India and Pakistan, which is mentioned in several Vedic Sanskrit hymns from this era.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]Kham was traditionally referred to as Chushi Gangdruk, i.e. 'four rivers and six ranges'. The peoples of Kham have endured a tumultuous past, their sovereignty often encroached upon and marginalized by both Tibetans to the West and the Han Chinese to the East.[PARAGRAPH:1]Kham was never controlled by a single king, but most of the chieftains revered the Dalai Lamas and often made contact with the Lhasa government. Kham was a patchwork of two dozen or more kingdoms, tribes, and chiefdoms that were constantly at war with each other. Since the collapse of the Tibetan Empire in the mid-9th century, the peoples of Kham had aggressively maintained their independence from invading nations. Local chieftains ruled their respective territories with hereditary titles bestowed by the Tibetan government. Chieftains were able to rule with a large degree of independence from both China and Tibet.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1717, Dzungar tribes of Mongolia invaded Tibet, and a period of internal strife and civil war followed. The Kangxi emperor sent armies into the area for 20 years, and local leaders were forced to pledge their allegiance to the Qing Empire. In 1724, the regions of Amdo and Kham were made into the province of Kokonor, with parts of Eastern Kham incorporated into neighboring Chinese provinces.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the early 19th century, Gombo Namgye raised a rebellion in Nyarong, an area of Eastern Kham. He is reported to have taken control of Eastern Tibet, excepting Amdo. Residents of Derge and the Hor States appealed to both Lhasa and the Manchu government for help against Namgye. China was unable to take action, but Tibetan authorities sent an army in 1863, and defeated Namgye in 1865. Tibet then claimed Nyarong, Derge (or De-ge) and the Hor States north of Nyarong. This appears to have been accepted by the Manchu emperor.[PARAGRAPH:1]Tibetan control of the Batang region of Kham appears to have continued uncontested from an agreement made in 1726 until soon after the invasion of Tibet by Francis Younghusband in 1904, which alarmed the Qing rulers in China. They sent an imperial official to the region to begin reasserting Qing control, but the locals revolted and killed him. The Qing government in Beijing then appointed Zhao Erfeng, the Governor of Xining, "Army Commander of Tibet" to reintegrate Tibet into China. He was sent in 1905 (though other sources say this occurred in 1908) on a punitive expedition and began destroying many monasteries in Kham and Amdo and implementing a process of sinification of the region:[PARAGRAPH:1]"He abolished the powers of the Tibetan local leaders and appointed Chinese magistrates in their places. He introduced new laws that limited the number of lamas and deprived monasteries of their temporal power and inaugurated schemes for having the land cultivated by Chinese immigrants.[PARAGRAPH:1]Zhao's methods in eastern Tibet uncannily prefigured the Communist policies nearly half a century later. They were aimed at the extermination of the Tibetan clergy, the assimilation of territory and repopulation of the Tibetan plateaus with poor peasants from Sichuan. Like the later Chinese conquerors, Zhao's men looted and destroyed Tibetan monasteries, melted down religious images and tore up sacred texts to use to line the soles of their boots and, as the Communists were also to do later, Zhao Erfeng worked out a comprehensive scheme for the redevelopment of Tibet that covered military training reclamation work, secular education, trade and administration."[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1910, the Qing government sent a military expedition of its own to establish direct Chinese rule. They deposed the 13th Dalai Lama in an imperial edict and instigated a search for a new incarnation.. The Dalai Lama then fled to British India in February 1910. While in India, the Dalai Lama became a close friend of Charles Alfred Bell, a British diplomatic officer stationed in Sikkim and a critic of Great Britain's policies in the region. "By going in and then coming out again, we knocked the Tibetans down and left them for the first comer to kick," wrote Bell later. The situation was soon to change, however, as, after the fall of the Qing dynasty in October 1911, Zhao's soldiers mutinied and beheaded him.[PARAGRAPH:1]The 13th Dalai Lama fled to British India in February 1910. The same month, the Chinese Qing government issued a proclamation deposing the Dalai Lama and instigating the search for a new incarnation.[PARAGRAPH:1]The official position of the British Government was it would not intervene between China and Tibet and would only recognize the de facto government of China within Tibet at this time. Bell, in his history of Tibet, wrote of this time that "the Tibetans were abandoned to Chinese aggression, an aggression for which the British Military Expedition to Lhasa and subsequent retreat [and consequent power vacuum within Tibet) were primarily responsible". Later, Britain defined the Indo-Tibetan border at the 1914 Simla Accord with the McMahon Line. China's delegation refused to agree to the line and still claims the land India received from Tibet as South Tibet, although the McMahon line remains the de facto border.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1932, an agreement signed between Chinese warlord Liu Wenhui and Tibetan forces formalized the partition of Kham into two regions: Eastern Kham, which was administered by Chinese forces, and Western Kham, which was administered by Tibet. Eastern Kham subsequently became the actual area of control of China's Xikang province. The border between eastern and western Kham is the Yangtze River - Dri Chu in Tibetan and Jinsha Jiang, or Chang Jiang respectively, in Chinese.[PARAGRAPH:1]In 1950, following the defeat of the Kuomintang rulers of China by communist forces in the Chinese Civil War, the People's Liberation Army entered western Kham. Western Kham was then set up as a separate Qamdo Territory , then merged into Tibet Autonomous Region in 1965. Meanwhile, Xikang province, comprising eastern Kham, was merged into Sichuan province in 1955. The border between Sichuan and Tibet Autonomous Region has remained the Yangtze River. The northernmost region of Kham, Yushu, has been a part of Qinghai province since the 18th century.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A camel is an even-toed ungulate within the genus Camelus, bearing distinctive fatty deposits known as humps on its back. There are two species of camels: the dromedary or Arabian camel has a single hump, and the bactrian has two humps. Dromedaries are native to the dry desert areas of West Asia, and Bactrian camels are native to Central and East Asia. Both species are domesticated.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Camels provide milk and meat, and are working animals. Their hair is also used as a source material for woven goods, ranging from Bedouin tents to garments. They are well-suited to long desert journeys and can carry a great deal of cargo, allowing substantial trade over desert regions since ancient times. Camels have been used in wars throughout Africa, the Middle East and India, both as mounts and freight animals, instead of horses and mules.
TEXT.German: No Translation

TEXT.English: [TAB]The history of coffee begins in the 9th century. It is thought to have originated in the highlands of Ethiopia and spread to the rest of the world via Egypt and Europe. The word coffee is derived from the Arabic word Qah'wa, over Ottoman Turkish Kahve, which originally meant wine or other intoxicating liquors. Partly due to the Islamic prohibition on drinking alcohol, preparing and drinking coffee became an important social ritual. In the 15th century, Muslims introduced coffee in Persia, Egypt, northern Africa and Turkey, where the first cafeteria, Kiva Han, opened in 1475 in Constantinople. The stimulant effect of drinking coffee caused it to be forbidden among orthodox and conservative imams in Mecca in 1511 and in Cairo in 1532 by a theological court. In Egypt, coffeehouses and warehouses containing coffee cherries were sacked. But the product's popularity, particularly among intellectuals, led to the reversal of this decision in 1524 by an order of the Ottoman Turkish Sultan Selim I. From the Muslim world, coffee spread to Europe, where it became popular in the 17th century. Dutch traders were the first to start large scale import of coffee into Europe.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'histoire de café commence dans le neuvième siècle. Il est pensé avoir provenu dans les pays de montagne d'Ethiopie et de diffusion au reste du monde via l'Egypte et d'Europe. Le café de mot est dérivé du Qah'wa de mot arabe, par-dessus Kahve turc ottoman, qui a signifié au début le vin ou l'autres enivrer alcools. Partiellement en raison de la prohibition islamique sur boire d'alcool, préparant et boire le café est devenu un rite social important. Dans le 15e siècle, Musulmans ont introduit le café dans Perse, l'Egypte, Afrique et Turquie septentrionaux, où le premier cafétéria, Kiva Han, ouvert dans 1475 dans Constantinople. L'effet de stimulant de boire de café a causé l'être défendu parmi imams orthodoxe et conservateur dans Mecque dans 1511 et dans Caire dans 1532 par un tribunal théologique. Dans l'Egypte, les cafés et les entrepôts contenant les cerises de café ont été sacked. Mais la popularité du produit, particulièrement parmi les intellectuels, mené au renversement de cette décision dans 1524 par un ordre du Sultan Selim I. turc ottoman. Du monde Musulman, la diffusion de café à Europe, où il est devenu populaire dans le 17e siècle. Les commerçants hollandais étaient le premier commencer la grande importation à l'échelle de café dans Europe.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Geschichte des Kaffees beginnt im 9. Jahrhundert. Es ist gedacht, in den Hochländern von Äthiopien und Ausbreitung zur restlichen Welt über Ägypten und Europa hervorgebracht zu haben. Der Wortkaffee ist vom arabischen Wort Qah'wa, über Ottoman türkischem Kahve abgeleitet, der ursprünglich Wein oder andere Berauschenalkohole bedeutet hat. Teilweise auf Grund des islamischen Verbots auf Trinkenalkohol, der und Trinkenkaffee vorbereitet, ist geworden ein wichtiges soziales Ritual. Im 15. Jahrhundert haben Muslime Kaffee in Persien, Ägypten, nördlichen Afrika und die Türkei, eingeführt wo die erste Cafeteria, Kiva Han, geöffnet in 1475 in Constantinople. Die Anregungswirkung, Kaffee zu trinken, hat verursacht, dass es unter orthodoxem und konservativem imams in Mekka in 1511 und in Kairo in 1532 durch einen theologischen Gerichtshof verboten wird. In Ägypten wurden coffeehouses und Lagerhäuser, die Kaffeekirschen enthalten, rausgeschmissen. Aber die Popularität hat des Produkts, besonders unter Intellektuelle, zur Umkehrung von dieser Entscheidung in 1524 durch einen Reihenfolge den Ottoman türkischen Sultan Selim I. geführt. Von der Muslimisch Welt Kaffeeausbreitung nach Europa, wo es populär im 17. Jahrhundert geworden ist. Holländische Händler waren das erste, Großmaßstabimport des Kaffees in Europa anzufangen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La storia di caffè inizia nel secolo 9. È pensato avere provenuto nella regione montuosa di Etiopia e nella coperta al riposo del mondo via Egitto ed in Europa. Il caffè di parola è derivato dal Qah'wa di parola Arabo, sopra Kahve Ottomano turco, che ha significato originalmente il vino o l'altro inebria i liquori. In parte dovuto alla proibizione Islamica su bere di alcool, preparando ed il caffè di bere è diventato un rituale importante sociale. Nel secolo 15, Musulmani hanno introdotto il caffè in Persia, Egitto, Africa del nord ed il Tacchino, dove la prima mensa, Kiva Han, aperto in 1475 in Costantinopoli. L'effetto di stimolante di bere di caffè l'ha causato essere vietato fra fra l'imams ortodosso e conservatore in Mecca in 1511 ed in Cairo in 1532 da un tribunale teologico. In Egitto, i caffè ed i magazzini contenendo le ciliegie di caffè sono stato sacked. Ma la popolarità del prodotto, particolarmente fra gli intellettuali, condotti all'inversione di questa decisione in 1524 da un ordine del Selim di Sultano Ottomano turco I. Dal mondo Musulmano, la coperta di caffè a Europa, dove è diventato popolare nel secolo 17. I commercianti olandesi erano il primo cominciare l'importazione di larga scala di caffè in Europa.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La historia de café empieza en el siglo IX. Es pensado haber originado en las tierras altas de Etiopía y la extensión al resto del mundo vía Egipto y Europa. El café de la palabra es derivado de la palabra árabe Qah'wa, sobre Kahve turco otomano, que significó originalmente vino u otro intoxicando los licores. En parte debido a la prohibición Islámica en el alcohol potable, preparando y café potable llegó a ser un ritual social importante. En el siglo XV, los musulmanes introdujeron café en Persia, Egipto, Africa septentrionales y Turquía, donde el primer restaurante, Kiva Han, abrió en 1475 en Constantinopla. El efecto de estimulante de café potable causó que estuviera prohibido entre imanes ortodoxos y conservadores en Meca en 1511 y en El Cairo en 1532 por un tribunal teológico. En Egipto, los cafés y los almacenes que contienen cerezas de café fueron ensacados. Pero la popularidad del producto, especialmente entre intelectuales, llevó a la reversión de esta decisión en 1524 por una orden del Sultán turco otomano Selim I. Del mundo musulmán, la extensión de café a Europa, donde lo llegó a ser popular en el siglo XVII. Los comerciantes holandeses fueron el primer de empezar la importación grande de la escala de café en Europa.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Football (also known as association football or soccer) is a team sport played between two teams, of 11 players each, and is widely considered to be the most popular sport in the world. The modern game was officiated in England following the formation of the Football Association, whose 1863 set of rules created the foundations for how the sport is played today. Football is governed internationally by the FIFA. The most prestigious international football competition is the World Cup, played every four years, which is also the most widely viewed and famous sporting event in the world, even more popular than the Summer Olympics. In many parts of the world football evokes great passions and plays an important role in the life of individual fans, local communities, and even nations.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le football est un sport collectif opposant deux équipes de onze joueurs chacune. Il est largement admis qu'il s'agit du sport le plus populaire au monde. Le jeu moderne a été créé en Angleterre après la formation de la Football Association, dont les règles de 1863 ont servi de base pour définir le sport tel qu'il se joue aujourd'hui. Le football est géré au niveau international par la FIFA. La compétition internationale de football la plus prestigieuse est la Coupe du Monde, organisée tous les quatre ans, qui est aussi l'événement sportif le plus célèbre et le plus regardé au monde. La Coupe du Monde de football est même plus populaire que les jeux olympiques d'été. Dans bien des régions du monde, le football suscite les passions et joue un rôle important dans la vie des fans, des communautés locales et même des nations.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Fußball ist ein Ballsport, bei dem zwei Mannschaften mit je elf Spielern (einem Torhüter und zehn Feldspielern) gegeneinander antreten. Er gilt weithin als die beliebteste Sportart der Welt. Heute gilt England als das Mutterland des Fußballs, denn dort wurde 1863 in London die Football Association (FA) gegründet wurde, welche das umfangreiche Regelwerk aufstellte, das die Grundlage für die heutige Spielweise in diesem Sport bildet. International ist der Fußballsport im Weltverband FIFA organisiert. Das bedeutendste internationale Fußballturnier ist die Fußballweltmeisterschaft, die alle vier Jahre ausgetragen wird. Sie stellt die weltweit berühmteste und meist gesehene Sportveranstaltung überhaupt dar und ist sogar noch populärer als die Olympischen Sommerspiele. In vielen Teilen der Welt weckt der Fußballsport große Leidenschaft und spielt im Leben der einzelnen Fans, regionaler Gemeinschaften und auch Nationen eine bedeutende Rolle.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il calcio è uno sport di squadra giocato fra due squadre, ognuna composta da 11 giocatori, ed è considerato lo sport più popolare al mondo. Il gioco moderno nacque in Inghilterra in seguito alla formazione della Football Association, le cui regole del 1863 crearono le fondamenta dello sport conosciuto oggi. Il calcio è governato a livello internazionale dalla FIFA. Il torneo internazionale più prestigioso è la Coppa del Mondo: si gioca ogni quattro anni ed è l'evento sportivo più conosciuto e visto a livello mondiale, ancora più popolare delle Olimpiadi. In molte parti del mondo il calcio alimenta grandi passioni e gioca un ruolo importante nella vita dei singoli fan, delle comunità e addirittura delle nazioni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El fútbol, sin duda el deporte más popular del mundo, se juega entre dos equipos de once jugadores cada uno. El juego moderno fue oficializado en Inglaterra con la fundación de la "Football Association", o "Asociación de Fútbol", cuyo conjunto de 1.863 normas supuso la base del deporte que se juega hoy en día. La FIFA es la organización que rige los destinos del fútbol a nivel internacional. La competición de mayor prestigio es la Copa del Mundo, que se juega cada cuatro años y genera más expectación que ningún otro evento deportivo del mundo, incluyendo los Juegos Olímpicos. En muchas partes del mundo el fútbol suscita grandes pasiones y juega un papel muy importante en las vidas de los aficionados, comunidades locales e incluso naciones.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Made from the leaves or buds of a bush, tea is the liquid created by soaking the extracted foliage in water and it is a popular beverage throughout the world. The "Camellia Sinesis," (tea plant), is grown in tropical and sub-tropical regions of the planet such as China or India. Originally from Southeast Asia, it early on became a staple in the diet of many person from the Orient. It was not until the sixteenth or seventeenth century that it was introduced to Europe as explorers crossed the globe in search of knowledge and treasure. Tea quickly became popular with the wealthy of Western Europe, and Britain would set up numerous plantations in its colony of India to help satiate the demand - India today remains the biggest producer of tea in the world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Constitué de feuilles ou de bourgeons d'un buisson, le thé est préparé en trempant l'extrait de feuillage dans de l'eau, et c'est une boisson extrêmement populaire à travers le monde. Le "Camellia Sinesis" (la plante) pousse dans les régions tropicales et subtropicales de la planète, et notamment en Chine et en Inde. Originaire d'Asie du Sud-est, le thé devient très tôt un produit de base dans le régime alimentaire de nombreux habitants de l'Orient. Il n'est pas introduit avant le XVIe ou XVIIe siècles en Europe, quand les explorateurs font le tour du monde en quête de nouvelles connaissances et richesses. Le thé devient vite très populaire au sein des classes supérieures de l'Europe de l'ouest et la Grande-Bretagne crée de nombreuses plantations dans ses colonies des Indes pour répondre à la demande. L'Inde reste aujourd'hui le premier producteur mondial.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Aufguss aus den Blättern oder Knospen eines Busches zubereitet, ist Tee zu einem weltweit beliebten Getränk geworden. Die "Camellia Sinensis" (Teegewächs) wird in tropischen und subtropischen Regionen wie China oder Indien angebaut. Ursprünglich aus Südostasien stammend, wurde der Tee zu einem wichtigen Bestandteil der orientalischen Ernährungsweise. Erst im 16. oder 17. Jahrhundert brachten Forschungsreisende die Teepflanze schließlich auch nach Europa. Da der Tee als Getränk im reichen Westeuropa großen Anklang fand, legten die Briten in ihrer Kolonie Indien zahlreiche Plantagen an, um die steigende Nachfrage befriedigen zu können, und auch heute noch gehört Indien zu den größten Tee produzierenden Ländern der Welt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ricavato dalle foglie o dalle gemme di un arbusto, il tè è una bevanda popolare in tutto il mondo che si ottiene immergendo le foglie nell'acqua calda. la "camellia sinesis" (la pianta del tè) cresce nelle regioni tropicali e sub-tropicali del pianeta (Cina e India, per esempio). Originario del sudest asiatico, ben presto il tè entrò a far parte della dieta di molti orientali, mentre fu introdotto in Europa soltanto nel sedicesimo o diciassettesimo secolo, portato da esploratori che giravano il mondo in lungo e in largo in cerca di nuove conoscenze e tesori. Il tè raccolse in breve tempo il consenso delle classi agiate europee e per soddisfare la domanda, l'Inghilterra creò enormi piantagioni in India, che ancora oggi rimane il più grande produttore di tè al mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El té, líquido creado por la infusión en agua de las hojas o los brotes de un matorral, es una bebida que goza de gran fama en todo el mundo.
